commit_message:
Change used keystone token provider in devstack

This patch changes used keystone token provider from 'uuid' to 'fernet'
in devstack creation script new-octavia-devstack.sh, because the uuid
type deprecated. Changes in keystone:
I76d5c29f6b1572ee3ec7f2b1af63ff31572de2ce

Change-Id: Ia42d8afe62413aa086d9a3751171d42042a700a8
Blueprint: removed-as-of-rocky
Story: 2001732

commit_message:
Add nova profile use block_device_mapping_v2 image check

If nova profile use block_device_mapping_v2 schema, When this
parameter specifies the special source_type and uuid, we need
to test the special source_type to detect whether the uuid is
a valid parameter.

Example the source_type value 'image', the physical vm will use
bootable volume create.

Change-Id: I409fbf52a42de0988c5aa5a1e2dd15e2b983a811
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2018-03-26 14:47:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix: Doc build by referring the Footnote

Footnote for zabbix manual was defined but not referenced,
this causes Sphinx WARNING: Footnote [#] is not referenced
and fails doc build(tox -edocs) as Warning is treated as
Error is enabled by adding flag(-W). This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: If2a85ec55f8e5ee887c49c2f603c1357f7166f93
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: Doc build by referring the Footnote

Footnote for zabbix manual was defined but not referenced,
this causes Sphinx WARNING: Footnote [#] is not referenced
and fails doc build(tox -edocs) as Warning is treated as
Error is enabled by adding flag(-W). This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: If2a85ec55f8e5ee887c49c2f603c1357f7166f93

subject: Silence bashate
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-26 07:14:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-03-26 07:41:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-03-27 05:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-26 07:14:45.000000000', 'message': 'Silence bashate

The remaining bashate warnings was E042:
 The return value of "local" is always 0; errors in subshells
 used for declaration are thus hidden and will not trigger "set
 -e".

Fix the few cases this triggered so that we don't get confused anymore
about the message.

Remove -v from bashate invocation, we don't need to print out all the
filenames anymore.

Change-Id: I47991a7040c8b9183bc72cce8e5d95b2cec7e6c5
'}]
commit_message:
Silence bashate

The remaining bashate warnings was E042:
 The return value of "local" is always 0; errors in subshells
 used for declaration are thus hidden and will not trigger "set
 -e".

Fix the few cases this triggered so that we don't get confused anymore
about the message.

Remove -v from bashate invocation, we don't need to print out all the
filenames anymore.

Change-Id: I47991a7040c8b9183bc72cce8e5d95b2cec7e6c5

commit_message:
Dashboard creator: fix bugs query

Gerrit used to allow regexps in topic: queries, but now topic: is only
for exact matches. intopic: can be used to search within topics.

Change-Id: Icc5c80ead124b4383198915984543a7987b1bf2e

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ic5fa4edff518a453941ec3d288f7a859adccec76
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22833, 'date': '2018-01-16 12:37:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-01-18 08:39:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2018-01-24 10:16:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Just be creating another file without learning it's content, which is fully calculable from the other (similar size file) we gain nothing.

It does not makes the content more unique, like an uuid or any random data generation would.

md5sum is typically used to be able to verify (large) content integrity. The time-stamp is small enough to not worry about keeping it in tempest memory, so we can compare the full content.

I did not get what are you trying to solve by this ASIS.
Please make it a more complete solution and have better point in the commit massage, because ASIS we gain nothing."}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2018-03-27 05:18:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Data integrative with md5

Add the ability to hash a file for testing file verification with
md5 algorithm. This new feature will allow to add better tests
for volume data integraty.

Change-Id: I6c50743d6755c9d7272d158ba246deebc80f31af

commit_message:
Install python2-networking-baremetal in neutron-server

This package contain the ML2 plug-in. Baremetal mechanism driver used
to integrate Ironic and Neutron. This is required for routed networks
support in Ironic.

Also required for routed networks support in containerized undercloud.

Change-Id: I12c36754f8da8dfb8d428ad749afca4b294ec4c4

Allow users to access the console and log into the running
instances on libvirt for debug purposes.

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2018-03-13 11:47:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-03-19 09:51:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

An overcloud normally has containers named nova_api and nova_metadata. I think using the nova-api name for the metadata container check is confusing. Could you please elaborate the names picked?'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2018-03-20 13:06:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

While there is nova-api and nova-metadata containers, both of them are running on nova-api image. As you can see, there is no nova-metadata container in kolla [1]. So statement in tripleo_kolla_template_overrides is invalid and the proper footer to use for nova-metadata container is the nova_api_footer, which basically means, we need to have single healthcheck script for both services, because you don't know which service will run on the image at the end in the time of applying our overrides.  

[1] https://github.com/openstack/kolla/tree/master/docker/nova"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-03-22 17:35:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-03-27 01:13:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Add healthcheck script for Nova metadata

This patch adds script for docker health check of Nova metadata API
service. The script checks API service using curl.

Existing script healthcheck/nova-metadata is also removed as this
script is linked in nova_metadata_footer template block. This block
does not exist (anymore?) and we have to have metadata check as part
of nova-api check, because those two services share container image.

Change-Id: I597efc57f9c564409b566c598d9d2467bb31d8cd

This change allows configuring whether and how Ironic stores ramdisk
logs from the deployment process. By default, logs are stored locally
in /var/log/ironic/deploy (this matches the upstream defaults).
The logs are stored on every deployment if debug is enabled, otherwise
only on failed deployments.

Change-Id: Iab481f67cf8a844b47d791130a428a5ca06bb454
(cherry picked from commit d347636ad5068132960bd793cba37ac1058f1153)
'}]
commit_message:
Configure deploy logs for Ironic

This change allows configuring whether and how Ironic stores ramdisk
logs from the deployment process. By default, logs are stored locally
in /var/log/ironic/deploy (this matches the upstream defaults).
The logs are stored on every deployment if debug is enabled, otherwise
only on failed deployments.

Change-Id: Iab481f67cf8a844b47d791130a428a5ca06bb454
(cherry picked from commit d347636ad5068132960bd793cba37ac1058f1153)

commit_message:
Increase the /var partition from 7G to 10G

Latest contents in overcloud image caused the need to have at least
7.3G free for /var partition, while we dimensioned for 7. Increasing
that to 10G, to fix the issue, and also be prepared for future
content increases, and give more room for installation.

Change-Id: Id699643626cbd83439729cfcd36e8ad17d0ebee7
Depends-On: I3885a5c359b56c515dbb9286ded1dee062cdcffc
Fixes-Bug: #1756319

commit_message:
Pass plan/stack name into config_download workflow

Without this --config-download won't work with any non-default
--stack argument.

Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/workflows/deployment.py

Change-Id: I3bde2a1526326c5d97cc1750d078b86b329ae84b
Depends-On: I24345a5b8a106ef0a166764a926159e109c4494e
Closes-Bug: #1755525
(cherry picked from commit 23323867d849ee59b21f69bb3408e4cdb9ba8bb7)

Add support for Dell EMC XtremIO Cinder ISCSI Backend

This change adds a new define for cinder::backend::dellemc_xtremio_iscsi

Change-Id: Icf4a199383064e7884953f0f5085dcef54c3b9a4
Implements: blueprint dellemc-xtremeio-cinder
(cherry picked from commit a462d796a7a1efe17c399e81395a22610b016952)

 - fix the check method for octavia-health-manager service

commit_message:
Don't delete the tripleo Zaqar queue

Now that we share a queue with other commands and other clients (the GUI
at least) we should never delete the queue.

Closes-Bug: #1757984
Change-Id: I1555b5e43984dea941885f221c4ec46092a34735

[{'created': '2018-03-27 03:47:21.000000000', 'message': 'rename project users internal column name

This column should have always been roles, this renames that

commit_message:
rename project users internal column name

This column should have always been roles, this renames that
properly. No point having the data source be called roles
and the column be called role.

Change-Id: I6ce736bfa1449fccf8f9f96d504a236546d76e82

partition, and that we need to increase the final size of the
image to 23G to fit the needs. And we need to rebalance the
percentage used by volumes to have similar sizes.

Change-Id: Icf25fc15bd71a50e68038012683e3e56aaa72443

commit_message:
Increase the image size to 23G

The recent tests showed that we need more space for the /var
partition, and that we need to increase the final size of the
image to 23G to fit the needs. And we need to rebalance the
percentage used by volumes to have similar sizes.

Change-Id: Icf25fc15bd71a50e68038012683e3e56aaa72443
Depends-On: I3885a5c359b56c515dbb9286ded1dee062cdcffc
(cherry picked from commit e86b30a73f6a80da137ad0a5d26b96c263d33bcd)

write implementation.

commit_message:
File copy timesout when file is too big

File copy times out when file is too big due to an problem with paramiko
write implementation.

The fix proposed comes in two parts:
 1) Changing paramiko file write to putfo;
 2) Increase the default copy file timeout.

Change-Id: I9e9d2873d95923cbd8c4729b3a674dfb1b8c2ec1
Story: #1705762

commit_message:
Fix the nova config file location

The location of the nova config file changed after the service was
containerized. This patch fixes the location to make the Nova
NoOpFirewallDriver validation work again.

Partial-Bug: #1744322
Change-Id: I9151f68d6674b8c39168d388c902fe05f802fa83
(cherry picked from commit bba2ec19bdbf7599d0322d0270c00a57b864fec2)

commit_message:
Prevent mocks in test_dnsmasq_pxe_filter from conflicting with oslo.config

oslo.config starts using os.path functions in the next release in set_override.
This change modifies unit tests to prevent mocks from clashing with it.

Change-Id: I6096cb61ef9733e761a5d3d7a24109575f685fe9
Closes-Bug: #1754026

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I7b1a6743bea281fc8c75fd8ad062973c51539670
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I7b1a6743bea281fc8c75fd8ad062973c51539670
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-22 05:45:51.000000000', 'message': "Enable hostnetwork for heapster

Currently kube-apiserver can't access pod ip, like heapster
service. Specify hostnetwork = true can fix it.

Change-Id: I92766b71a55168871a124dc21bb730857a581056
"}, {'created': '2018-03-22 05:47:38.000000000', 'message': "Enable hostnetwork for heapster

Currently kube-apiserver can't access pod ip, like heapster
service. Specify hostnetwork = true can fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1757936

Change-Id: I92766b71a55168871a124dc21bb730857a581056
"}, {'created': '2018-03-26 10:34:40.000000000', 'message': "Update the args of heapster

Heapster seems can't access 'https://kubernetes.default', specify
'--source=kubernetes.summary_api:''' work fine.

Related-Bug: #1757936

Change-Id: I92766b71a55168871a124dc21bb730857a581056
"}]
commit_message:
Update the args of heapster

Heapster seems can't access 'https://kubernetes.default', specify
'--source=kubernetes.summary_api:''' work fine.

Related-Bug: #1757936

Change-Id: I92766b71a55168871a124dc21bb730857a581056

Use the pbr generated wsgi binary file located in binary folder

Since pbr 1.4.0, wsgi_scripts entrypoing is supported and it will
generated a wsgi compatible binary file.

Switch multinode tests to non-voting

This is temporary while multinode issues are figured out, so they don't
completely block our gates.
Revert this when they are passing consistently.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-11 11:26:29.000000000', 'message': 'Remove already-deprecated strict_policy_check option

The option ``[patrole].strict_policy_check`` was deprecated
during the last release cycle (Queens). This was because the
option could be set to False in order to skip tests which
might result in false positives.

However, during the Rocky PTG, it was determined that this also
breaks backwards compatibility. For example, if Cinder policy
"foo" in Pike is renamed to "bar" in Queens, then if Patrole
fails on the test that checks for "bar" in a Pike cloud, then this
is a spurious failure: the test failed because there is no
stable deprecation phase for policies in OpenStack, not because
the policy or the test are necessarily invalid.

As a compromise, a LOG.warning is emitted and the test is skipped
if the policy could not be found, which is required to calculate
the expected test result.

This PS, then, removes strict_policy_check references in the code,
updates documentation, adds a releasenote, and updates the
previous releasenote to make the backwards compatible logic
clearer. A follow up will be needed to expound on backwards
compatibility in Patrole documentation.

Alternatives to this change include supporting a "fallback" rule:
however, because Patrole (like Tempest) should support up to n-2
release, this means that at most a test may have to have up to
3 policies: 1 for n, 1 for n-1, and 1 for n-2, though in practice
this is unlikely. Still, this leads to a maintenance issue with
Patrole having to maintain 2 or 3 policies for some tests. This
is exacerbated by the fact that most projects only recently moved
to policy in code in Queens, when documentation of policies
became clear for the first time. Patrole, therefore, would have to
rely on the same guesswork as in the past for the n-1/n-2 policies
-- at least for the next few cycles if this alternative were
implemented.

At a later time, a more robust approach that balances backwards
compatibility concerns with false positive backwards may be
designed and implemented.

Change-Id: I7f7eda39c0472bd3d70892c801fc4d14db0c0426
'}, {'created': '2018-03-12 03:13:47.000000000', 'message': 'Remove already-deprecated strict_policy_check option

As a compromise, a LOG.warning is emitted and the test is skipped

however, because Patrole (like Tempest) should support up to n-2

commit_message:
Remove already-deprecated strict_policy_check option

The option ``[patrole].strict_policy_check`` was deprecated
during the last release cycle (Queens). This was because the
option could be set to False in order to skip tests which
might result in false positives.

This PS, then, removes strict_policy_check references in the code,
updates documentation, and adds a releasenote.

Change-Id: I7f7eda39c0472bd3d70892c801fc4d14db0c0426

Verify YAML syntax in gates

This patchset implements yamllint test to all *.yml
files.

Also fixes syntax errors to make jobs to pass.

Change-Id: I3186adf9835b4d0cada272d156b17d1bc9c2b799

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

[{'created': '2018-03-26 23:41:22.000000000', 'message': 'Remove final from publish-zuul-website

The zuul-website repo inherits from this job.  Since the job is
post-review (due to secrets), and only allowed by zuul-website,
it should be safe enough to permit this.

Change-Id: If405beae9463401c0a4b157878fdd506a147e7fe
'}]
commit_message:
Remove final from publish-zuul-website

The zuul-website repo inherits from this job.  Since the job is
post-review (due to secrets), and only allowed by zuul-website,
it should be safe enough to permit this.

Change-Id: If405beae9463401c0a4b157878fdd506a147e7fe

subject: Support network stats for VF representor interface in libvirt inspector
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26240, 'name': 'libaoan', 'email': 'baoan_008@163.com', 'username': 'baoan'}, {'_account_id': 27249, 'name': 'Jai Singh Rana', 'email': 'jai.rana@gmail.com', 'username': 'jrana'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 27249, 'date': '2017-12-20 11:06:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-12-20 11:06:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2017-12-20 11:08:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This code should be in libvirt.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-12-20 18:12:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

agree with sileht. this is useful beyond ceilometer so it'd be good to get it into libvirt. the parts not useful for libvirt can remain here.

i'll also be honest, you clearly have more knowledge about this than i do so please feel free to point out which parts you believe should be in ceilometer."}, {'account_id': 27249, 'date': '2017-12-21 13:43:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I understand sileht's concern that libvirt should be able to support this feature. I guess since with pure SR-IOV passthrough, this feature could not be supported in general in libvirt as packets bypass hypervisor. As VF representor model(switchdev) is pretty new (support started in Pike), hence added support in ceilometer libvirt inspector itself.

sileht, do you think this code can placed in some other path in ceilometer instead of libvirt inspector which uses libvirt api's to fetch interface stats and not its own?
Or is it strictly should come from libvirt."}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2017-12-21 14:00:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

libvirt is NOT an hypervisor, but a tools to manage them.

Can you provide a link that prove that this feature have been refused by libvirt community ?

I have already implemented this kind feature for some others use-cases (vhost-net and openvswitch network interface), I'm sure this should be welcomed.

libvirt already have an abstraction for that, you just need to implement it for SRVIO network interface. And that will just work for Ceilometer."}, {'account_id': 27249, 'date': '2017-12-21 15:15:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Was just asking for a opinion and have not approached libvirt community yet for this feature. Thanks for the feedback. As you have provided valuable inputs, will surely prepare patch for libvirt.'}, {'account_id': 26240, 'date': '2018-03-26 23:29:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

i don't think it's a good idea"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-20 11:06:41.000000000', 'message': "Support network stats for VF representor interface in libvirt inspector

Extended libvirt.inspector to support network stats for SR-IOV interface in
switchdev mode using its vf representor on host. Change probes interface type
'hostdev', performs pci_address to vf represenstor name mapping and get the
stats from /sys/class/net/$VF_Representor/statistics/

Change-Id: I315901c0514507e60484e02368449e16d2058bf0
Closes-bug: #1731890
"}]
commit_message:
Support network stats for VF representor interface in libvirt inspector

Extended libvirt.inspector to support network stats for SR-IOV interface in
switchdev mode using its vf representor on host. Change probes interface type
'hostdev', performs pci_address to vf represenstor name mapping and get the
stats from /sys/class/net/$VF_Representor/statistics/

Change-Id: I315901c0514507e60484e02368449e16d2058bf0
Closes-bug: #1731890

commit_message:
Remove deprecated switch_role method

This is to remove the deprecated switch_role method from
rbac_utils module as it has been replaced by override_role
which is a superior way to manipulate the underlying role used
for querying API endpoints in Tempest.

Change-Id: Ibaffcd8cd0b62ad792b0ef5f9be4d33ec31e8c7a

Add feature flags in config to enable tests conditionally

This would allow to skip tests if a required feature is not
enabled in the config.

commit_message:
Use the new dnsmasq PXE filter in ironic-inspector

With the introduction of rotued networks there can be
a situation where baremetal nodes on remote segments
are unintentionally introspected. Using the dnsmasq
based PXE filtering driver in ironic inspector fixes
the issue.

Co-Authored-By: Harald Jensås <hjensas@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1756075
Change-Id: I53d6c5718c7f9112d578ec6f73830830d2c71737
Depends-On: I056cdadc025f35d8b6fd22f510a7c0a8e259a1f0

commit_message:
Handle 408 and 503 error by trying once more

If 408(timeout), 503(service unavailable) errors encountered
then handle the error by requesting one more time.

Change-Id: Ia6c97ab3287a6ca297471901d5355c62ebcd34f8
Closes-Bug: #1535750

bug/1535750: remove the changes which i did not make from the branch

Change-Id: Ieb3af09f31ab9f87ba0e1ab5860d9eb4165f8952

commit_message:
Replace deprecated library function os.popen() with subprocess

os.popen() is deprecated since python 2.6.
Resolved with use of subprocess module.

Change-Id: I361fc8ba0545f12aa7b862a6a2f6878870e45108
Closes-Bug: #1529836

commit_message:
Fix next_hop for metadata service host route on local_subnet

The host route to the metadata service should use the
undercloud as next_hop when configuring the subnet that
is on the same L2 segment as the undercloud itself. The
code used to manage this was not correctly implemented.

Change-Id: Icf40af8ac424d14386aacda38cf674cc25273fc8
Closes-Bug: #1757418

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-23 22:58:25.000000000', 'message': 'Do not override NeutronServicePlugins in CI

The NeutronServicePlugins are overriden to an empty list in CI.
For routed ctlplane networking we need to load the segments plug-in.

Commit d00324220612d25c3653ebb61ddeaafbcfe5cb4f introduced the
behaviour which disables all the service plugins, but no explanation
why.

Closes-Bug: #1758455
Change-Id: Ifa76fee39c1b2886d5f1128c3cb8a3d68243fc25
'}]
commit_message:
Do not override NeutronServicePlugins in CI

The NeutronServicePlugins are overriden to an empty list in CI.
For routed ctlplane networking we need to load the segments plug-in.

Commit d00324220612d25c3653ebb61ddeaafbcfe5cb4f introduced the
behaviour which disables all the service plugins, but no explanation
why.

Closes-Bug: #1758455
Change-Id: Ifa76fee39c1b2886d5f1128c3cb8a3d68243fc25

commit_message:
Enable slow tests for lvm-barbican job

We would likely benefit by running
tempest.scenario.test_encrypted_cinder_volumes tests
and
TestVolumeBootPattern.test_create_server_from_volume_snapshot

Change-Id: I5082926cc5ede463d67e3ab995e17983b5db3855

commit_message:
[Unity] Add `force detach` support

Add support to force detach a volume from all hosts on Unity.

Closes-bug: #1741831
Change-Id: I5f0f3d474b00f3c1f742c1bfa6877911415c32f9
(cherry picked from commit b44721dfacc2b4b7f4b3bf07f813800c597a576a)

[{'created': '2018-03-26 15:40:46.000000000', 'message': 'Remove hardcoded eth0 MASQUERADE rule

Any data that should be masqueraded will be masqueraded
by the following rule which is earlier in the chain.

  iptables -t nat-A BOOTSTACK_MASQ_NEW -s $NETWORK ! -d $NETWORK -j MASQUERADE

Closes-Bug: #1690584
Change-Id: Ic30b24959ca3259974160abcfa213e6a14c953f5
(cherry picked from commit 333ca292fc0ea0945af3b35f5ca7e240a5902d92)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove hardcoded eth0 MASQUERADE rule

Any data that should be masqueraded will be masqueraded
by the following rule which is earlier in the chain.

  iptables -t nat-A BOOTSTACK_MASQ_NEW -s $NETWORK ! -d $NETWORK -j MASQUERADE

Closes-Bug: #1690584
Change-Id: Ic30b24959ca3259974160abcfa213e6a14c953f5
(cherry picked from commit 333ca292fc0ea0945af3b35f5ca7e240a5902d92)

commit_message:
Fix validate-template-override.

"echo >... <<EOF" idiom doesn't work as echo doesn't take its input from stdin.
This was just creating a file with an empty line.  Using cat fixes it.

Change-Id: I09f01ea854df38eea7bb6e99f43e4a792e458abe

commit_message:
Prepare action: extra arguments

This change adds arguments to the PrepareContainerImageEnv action, and
also adds the PrepareContainerImageDefaults action so that a UI can
discover the default mapping_args.

Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow
Change-Id: I0e49ec53b9e51a0fc50b1212f63bf7a127257da2

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-12-21 01:57:22.000000000', 'message': "Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove python-heatclient.

Change-Id: Ibd0c4be5d67a3d8e41008fe334459776e1a486f2
"}]
commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove python-heatclient.

Change-Id: Ibd0c4be5d67a3d8e41008fe334459776e1a486f2

Switch to neutron-tempest-plugin for tempest tests

* https://review.openstack.org/519310 syncs the code from neutron
  project to neutron-tempest-plugin repo and it is better to
  depend on new one in order to avoid the breakage.

I'm sick of dealing with this bug in the gate. Approving."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-10 01:08:12.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid race in OSWaitCondition test

While sending a signal to a WaitCondition is synchronous, the actual update
of the WaitConditionHandle metadata happens asynchronously since the fix
for bug 1394095. As a result, it's not guaranteed that even the first 6
signals (which are sent in serially, as opposed to the later ones which are
deliberately sent in parallel) will be stored in the same order that they
are sent.

Crucially, that means that one or more of the signals explicitly sent with
id 5 may arrive when there have been only three previous signals stored.
This means that the next signal to arrive with an implicit ID will be the
fifth signal stored, and therefore also get id 5. Of course we have a log
message to indicate when an existing signal is overwritten by another with
the same ID, and we are not seeing it except in the intended case where we
explicitly send in the same ID twice. That's because the keys have
different types in the data dict - the explicitly specified ID is the
string "5", but the implicitly calculated one is the integer 5. But - get
this - when we serialise the data to JSON both keys are serialised to the
string "5", and upon deserialisation they collide and one is silently
dropped on the floor.

So if the signal with the explicit ID "5" is stored just before the one
with reason "signal 4", then "signal 4" will effectively be silently
ignored as the 5th signal to arrive - a slot already filled. And since that
signal is ignored, the next signal will also be treated as the 5th to
arrive and ignored, and so on. This leads inexorably to the dreaded
"WaitConditionTimeout: resources.wait_condition: 4 of 25 received" error.

For this reason, it's a bad idea to mix explicit IDs that are also integers
with implicitly assigned IDs. Use an ID that won't collide instead.

Change-Id: I507b43dba8dcea87d3e0c179f7ca6b34b2b31a12
Closes-Bug: #1738653
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid race in OSWaitCondition test

While sending a signal to a WaitCondition is synchronous, the actual update
of the WaitConditionHandle metadata happens asynchronously since the fix
for bug 1394095. As a result, it's not guaranteed that even the first 6
signals (which are sent in serially, as opposed to the later ones which are
deliberately sent in parallel) will be stored in the same order that they
are sent.

Crucially, that means that one or more of the signals explicitly sent with
id 5 may arrive when there have been only three previous signals stored.
This means that the next signal to arrive with an implicit ID will be the
fifth signal stored, and therefore also get id 5. Of course we have a log
message to indicate when an existing signal is overwritten by another with
the same ID, and we are not seeing it except in the intended case where we
explicitly send in the same ID twice. That's because the keys have
different types in the data dict - the explicitly specified ID is the
string "5", but the implicitly calculated one is the integer 5. But - get
this - when we serialise the data to JSON both keys are serialised to the
string "5", and upon deserialisation they collide and one is silently
dropped on the floor.

So if the signal with the explicit ID "5" is stored just before the one
with reason "signal 4", then "signal 4" will effectively be silently
ignored as the 5th signal to arrive - a slot already filled. And since that
signal is ignored, the next signal will also be treated as the 5th to
arrive and ignored, and so on. This leads inexorably to the dreaded
"WaitConditionTimeout: resources.wait_condition: 4 of 25 received" error.

For this reason, it's a bad idea to mix explicit IDs that are also integers
with implicitly assigned IDs. Use an ID that won't collide instead.

Change-Id: I507b43dba8dcea87d3e0c179f7ca6b34b2b31a12
Closes-Bug: #1738653

commit_message:
Iptables firewall driver adds forward rules for trusted ports

Iptables firewall driver can now add process trusted ports and
adds rules for them to FORWARD chain.

Change-Id: I67d0f17b4b56671fc2e2dd6e2fc4518dc42cd131
Closes-Bug: #1720205
(cherry picked from commit 97b30494a9263db684e5901113b53c25e55d1854)

commit_message:
Verify certificates when makeing https request to cfn api

This patch gets the verify_cert parameter from the environment
set by the os-collect-config and use it to pass to the requests
libraray to verify certificates when making https request to heat
cfn api server.

Change-Id: Ib3572759bb9a12d65abbba521e48af0eb17ff396
Depends-On: I4f6262967ad346c6ff103cb359b02b81ef71573f

messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-22 19:18:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-22 20:31:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-26 21:24:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nWe decided we want to keep this command around in case we have to do an update by hand.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-22 19:18:46.000000000', 'message': 'remove update-requirements command

We no longer need a command to update the requirements in a repository
because we no longer sync dependencies into other repos.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: If2f2454dddbaca2cbc9ceb7693fc67c43f9b3899
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555426
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-03-22 20:31:51.000000000', 'message': 'remove update-requirements command

We no longer need a command to update the requirements in a repository
because we no longer sync dependencies into other repos.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: If2f2454dddbaca2cbc9ceb7693fc67c43f9b3899
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555426
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
remove update-requirements command

We no longer need a command to update the requirements in a repository
because we no longer sync dependencies into other repos.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: If2f2454dddbaca2cbc9ceb7693fc67c43f9b3899
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555426
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Support Qemu >= 2.10.0 in Quobyte driver

This adds using the '--force-share' option with qemu-img, similar to
the changes in Ia3623af2048d6cbda65deebf4404e6b5fefe1bfc .

Closes-Bug: #1758114

Change-Id: I5a06e10fbe03e4184c891733dde430b66109ce35

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-26 09:38:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix checking if the overcloud group is empty

The hostnamemap_override fact is failing in featureset027 because the
group overcloud is empty, and hostnamemap_override forces to access the
first object from this group. This patch add **one more** verification
for the overcloud group to contain at least one member.

Closes-Bug: #1757474

Change-Id: Ibfd73277cb93cdb26b6598f45e7f82e31897d2a4
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix checking if the overcloud group is empty

The hostnamemap_override fact is failing in featureset027 because the
group overcloud is empty, and hostnamemap_override forces to access the
first object from this group. This patch add **one more** verification
for the overcloud group to contain at least one member.

Closes-Bug: #1757474

Change-Id: Ibfd73277cb93cdb26b6598f45e7f82e31897d2a4
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2018-02-08 14:33:16.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I38c55953ce36f2a3bb71566992dec9e13a84fa45
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I38c55953ce36f2a3bb71566992dec9e13a84fa45

commit_message:
Add default configuration files to data_files

In order to make it simpler to use the default
configuration files when deploying services
from source, the files are added to pbr's
data_files section so that the files are
included in the built wheels and therefore
deployed with the code. Packaging and deployment
tools can then more easily use the default files
if they wish to.

This pattern is already established with similar
files for neutron and the glance metadefs as has
been mentioned in the related bug report.

Change-Id: I466f235fec7be024f654739a31365724eaf24097
Closes-Bug: #1718356

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ifc0a37fc787ed3340aefb7e182dbc74bb36352f2
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Any data that should be masqueraded will be masqueraded
by the following rule which is earlier in the chain.

  iptables -t nat-A BOOTSTACK_MASQ_NEW -s $NETWORK ! -d $NETWORK -j MASQUERADE

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded eth0 MASQUERADE rule

Any data that should be masqueraded will be masqueraded
by the following rule which is earlier in the chain.

  iptables -t nat-A BOOTSTACK_MASQ_NEW -s $NETWORK ! -d $NETWORK -j MASQUERADE

Closes-Bug: #1690584
Change-Id: Ic30b24959ca3259974160abcfa213e6a14c953f5
(cherry picked from commit 333ca292fc0ea0945af3b35f5ca7e240a5902d92)

commit_message:
Add healthcheck script for Horizon

This patch adds script for docker health check of Horizon.
The script checks the service using curl.

commit_message:
Urgent bump of lxc_hosts

Many patches are failing in gates due to gate profiles (disk
partitioning) due to a bug in our code which has been fixed
in the lxc_hosts role.

This bumps the lxc_hosts role to the stable/queens
sha fixing the machinectl quota [1], in order to help
gates.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts/commit/400f0c80b9c531a792dc01ff12cf1f3b3bd69a2d

Change-Id: I8351f559b46186c93e39d977da264bd4055c5b17

commit_message:
Drop ordereddict from g-r

This is a pypi backport of Py 2.7's new collections feature and
is only needed for Py 2.6+, which isn't widely supported anymore
by OpenStack. Time to remove the last remainders of it

Depends-On: I80d42abf5dd5565da424a90a93545ba82ef7a58d
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/551308
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/551309
Change-Id: Icb45edb9f606a750353aa023dba1b3ee977bd97f

- gate-heat-agents-python35 http://logs.openstack.org/43/489943/1/check/gate-heat-agents-python35/ff38316/ : SUCCESS in 4m 26s'}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2017-08-02 10:01:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8289, 'date': '2017-08-10 07:01:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-11-01 23:13:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

So this is changing from io.BytesIO (binary) to StringIO.StringIO (text) on Python2. That may be correct, but it's not obviously correct.

It may be correct because neither is is obviously correct that we were using binary mode for Python2 but text mode for Python3. It's the exact opposite of what six.BytesIO does, for example.

In any event, what we're changing here is actual functionality and not just cleaning up some if statements, and the commit message should reflect that and offer some justification for why it's correct."}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2017-11-02 06:13:35.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Kien Nguyen with the following votes:

OK, I figured it out :)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-26 20:10:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-26 20:11:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-02 09:23:02.000000000', 'message': 'Use six StringIO

This patch propose to use six.StringIO instead of a if condition
to checkon python verison.

Change-Id: Ib80e10a40e68ece946b344ce7bcfba5e182ce848
'}, {'created': '2018-03-26 20:10:47.000000000', 'message': "Use six StringIO

On python3, sys.stdin/stdout are Text-mode streams, which can be
approximated with io.StringIO. On python2, there's no real
distinction between Text-mode and Binary-mode (except for line
endings, which sys.stdin/stdout also treat as Text-mode). Hence,
there's no need to explicitly use io.BytesIO on python2.
StringIO.StringIO is equally or more representative of how the
mocked streams behave.

Therefore, just use six.StringIO instead of different types for
python2 vs. python3.

Change-Id: Ib80e10a40e68ece946b344ce7bcfba5e182ce848
"}]
commit_message:
Use six StringIO

On python3, sys.stdin/stdout are Text-mode streams, which can be
approximated with io.StringIO. On python2, there's no real
distinction between Text-mode and Binary-mode (except for line
endings, which sys.stdin/stdout also treat as Text-mode). Hence,
there's no need to explicitly use io.BytesIO on python2.
StringIO.StringIO is equally or more representative of how the
mocked streams behave.

Therefore, just use six.StringIO instead of different types for
python2 vs. python3.

Change-Id: Ib80e10a40e68ece946b344ce7bcfba5e182ce848

commit_message:
undercloud: add missing TLS environments when preparing containers

When undercloud_generate_service_certificate is set to true, keepalived
& HAproxy are deployed on the undercloud, so we need these containers
too.

Change-Id: I11436f5d6b0b6289c9a88469603400d0c595902c

commit_message:
Remove usage of TestCase.skip() method

It is deprecated since version 1.9.0 of testtools.
Instead of this deprecated method skipTest() is now used.

Change-Id: I7b6bbdbf43e7f428d5b3873a07fba7e6d629fa82

commit_message:
Add access to /var/run/openvswitch from collectd

container. Otherwise, the collectd-ovs-stats or
collectd-ovs-events plugins won't be able to read stats from
ovs.

Change-Id: I2520a6d25470f144589d957737ae8ac39d3215a2
(cherry picked from commit 0417a336b00de29192911df2da05e935b8d7c71e)

commit_message:
Handle adding ip address when it already exists

Adding IP address on device is now done with pyroute2 lib.
This commit handle the case when pyroute2 function raise
exception when same IP address is already configured on
device.
In such case it will now raise exception which inherits from
RuntimeError what is consistent with eariler code when it
was done by running "ip addr" command to configue IP.

Change-Id: I89f22310782f2f0baf0ce6b20d2ab0e1d68654a0
Related-Bug: #1492714

commit_message:
Assign Cinder's backend_host when deploying for HA

When deploying for HA, set cinder's backend_host option (not the host
option) to "hostgroup". That way, only the cinder-volume backend drivers
use a common value.

Closes-Bug: #1753596
Depends-On: I78a88725d297794efd854fbfb14df0611e0e0738
Change-Id: Ifa4cd1f43fd5d73fc21630cee45b9f38fa882349

commit_message:
Update default Cinder RBD backend_host value

The Cinder RBD driver's backend_host should use 'cinder::backend_host'
hiera data first, and only use 'cinder::host' if the preferred hiera
value isn't defined.

Partial-Bug: #1753596

When the backend_host option is specified, configure it in each
cinder-volume backend driver's section and not in the DEFAULT section.
Backend drivers only look for the option in their backend section, so
setting in the DEFAULT section had no effect.

Clarify the fact that the DEFAULT host option is *not* deprecated, and

Partial-Bug: #1753596
Change-Id: I11a55571f4bed630967242c797e08e11c47eab11
"}]
commit_message:
Fix location where backend_host is configured

When the backend_host option is specified, configure it in each
cinder-volume backend driver's section and not in the DEFAULT section.
Backend drivers only look for the option in their backend section, so
setting in the DEFAULT section had no effect.

Clarify the fact that the DEFAULT host option is *not* deprecated, and
is only deprecated in backend sections (where the backed_host should be
used).

Partial-Bug: #1753596
Change-Id: I11a55571f4bed630967242c797e08e11c47eab11

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ide4d192e390ac78f860634014f2437dd6ea7b919
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Add max MV for Queens and fix formatting

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-23 19:41:56.000000000', 'message': "Sync snapshot's encryption_key_id with volume's value

Sync the snapshot's encryption_key_id with the volume's value just
prior to updating the snapshot's DB entry. This ensures the snapshot
DB entry isn't out of date in case the volume's encryption_key_id
changed while the snapshot was in flight. The encryption_key_id will
change when keys based on the ConfKeyManager are migrated to Barbican.

Closes-Bug: #1756139
Change-Id: I65abb8dd17de7633828b731d1cf1f2321a6f3e5b
(cherry picked from commit 768c5235239c5207b1a3c6ca0605bbe5ed4a6a8e)
"}]
commit_message:
Sync snapshot's encryption_key_id with volume's value

Sync the snapshot's encryption_key_id with the volume's value just
prior to updating the snapshot's DB entry. This ensures the snapshot
DB entry isn't out of date in case the volume's encryption_key_id
changed while the snapshot was in flight. The encryption_key_id will
change when keys based on the ConfKeyManager are migrated to Barbican.

Closes-Bug: #1756139
Change-Id: I65abb8dd17de7633828b731d1cf1f2321a6f3e5b
(cherry picked from commit 768c5235239c5207b1a3c6ca0605bbe5ed4a6a8e)

gibi'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-26 08:47:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Andreas: OK, so this potential duplication is temporary. Then I have nothing against this patch.
cheers,
gibi"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-26 20:05:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

commit_message:
Migrate legacy-osc-placement-dsvm-functional job in-tree

This migrates the legacy-osc-placement-dsvm-functional job
from openstack-zuul-jobs and renames it to drop the legacy part
and branch override stuff.

Change-Id: I6dfcd4e327ea535fdee3ce740c9b817ed790de7e

commit_message:
WIP: Turn on new port binding extended live migrate flow

This "turns on" the real compute service version checks in
conductor such that live migrations will attempt to use the
new port binding flows if both computes are new enough, which
will be the case in our live migration CI job.

Eventually this patch gets squashed into change
Ie04ded7b0f4edbb98af92f2ce713cf712a83b383 but for now it
will be good to just see if the plumbing is working across the
various nova services and neutron API.

Change-Id: I50957ca96e1e1be72a829ec0e05f503d2b930470

commit_message:
Allow Tempest CI to add txt extensions to ini files

When looking at logs of the CI it's useful to be able to read certain
files in the browser. Most plain text files get a txt extension to allow
easier consumption. INI files lack this and thus are downloaded.

This patch allows the Tempest CI to add this extension to INI files.

Change-Id: I05ce7e28148d4edaf32049cc20065a5de5f5dbfc

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: If784de67c7929dfe8a816a17fd4f0c03cb1c3f9d
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Iaceac55505b73a8153f13937598805dd8469fcec
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Ensure ansible-pacemaker is present on the undercloud.

On upstream CI in mixed upgrade the undercloud doesn't have this
package by default.

This make the ffu upgrade fail during ffu_upgrade_playbook with:

  exception: no action detected in task. This often indicates a
  misspelled module name, or incorrect module path.

This make sure that this package is installed as it should on "normal"
installation.

Furthermore it directly includes the fix from
Id87a40c3f41ca6da2d449e891b1f05d2705d3909.

Change-Id: Ic3268aa1c0fb84d0039395186861e9dea838a6e3
(cherry picked from commit d195142ac546250a2df60ee1dc9ad7cfd78948af)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-26 10:02:47.000000000', 'message': 'Upgrade data on disk on mariadb major upgrade

Add an ansible task to run mysql_upgrade whenever a container
image upgrade causes a major upgrade of mariadb (e.g. 5.5 -> 10.1)

. If the overcloud was containerized prior to the major upgrade, the
  mysql upgrade job is ran in an ephemeral container (where the latest
  version of mysql comes from) and uses credentials from the Kolla
  configuration.

. Otherwise the upgrade job is run from the host (once the mysql
  rpm has been updated) and uses credentials from the host.

We log the output of the script in the journal. Also, the mysql server
needs to be started temporarily, so use a temporary log file for it
when run from the ephemeral container.

Change-Id: Id330d634ee214923407ea893fdf7a189dc477e5c
(cherry picked from commit 624fedb114d75d63ec0082948820eb380abc6a39)
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrade data on disk on mariadb major upgrade

Add an ansible task to run mysql_upgrade whenever a container
image upgrade causes a major upgrade of mariadb (e.g. 5.5 -> 10.1)

. If the overcloud was containerized prior to the major upgrade, the
  mysql upgrade job is ran in an ephemeral container (where the latest
  version of mysql comes from) and uses credentials from the Kolla
  configuration.

. Otherwise the upgrade job is run from the host (once the mysql
  rpm has been updated) and uses credentials from the host.

We log the output of the script in the journal. Also, the mysql server
needs to be started temporarily, so use a temporary log file for it
when run from the ephemeral container.

Change-Id: Id330d634ee214923407ea893fdf7a189dc477e5c
(cherry picked from commit 624fedb114d75d63ec0082948820eb380abc6a39)

commit_message:
Use tripleo-upgrade role for p->q job.

This makes use of the tripleo-upgrade role for Pike->Queens upgrade.

Depends-On: I4df06c8a0d5d8133ba64c38b90cef34793776422

Change-Id: I5823a99c4c8eca74f89185f0e643daec39891a3f

commit_message:
New featureset for fast forward upgrade testing.

We introduce a new featureset to be able to test Fast Forward Upgrade.

This is a upgrade from Newton to Queens.

As Queens has been released we need also to adjust the mixed release
file.

Related-Bug: #1742924

Depends-On: I4df06c8a0d5d8133ba64c38b90cef34793776422

Change-Id: I240c087941a25227382548136898cb3b172d2389

commit_message:
Include connectivity check prepare scripts during FFU

This change includes the connectivity check prepare scripts step
during FFU and it moves the tasks covering it to the
common dir and assigns specific tags for each FFU stage. In
addition it saves the floating IP address to a file so it can be
used in stages where Neutron API is not available.

Change-Id: I9d61f6eaa105e9eb2854eb749f570c395de155fe

commit_message:
Conventional log directories for pacemaker bundles

Use /var/log/containers/<service> instead of /var/log/<service>, as
the rest of the containerized services.

Change-Id: Id5760c16260de991ff95168c76186edc113752c8
Depends-On: Icb311984104eac16cd391d75613517f62ccf6696
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1731969
(cherry picked from commit d8d86cfe68f7002a9ac039cb2b41789547df21be)

What is nova behavior in this case? I couldn't find a similar config option there."}, {'account_id': 14852, 'date': '2018-03-15 12:29:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14852, 'date': '2018-03-15 12:33:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Antoni Segura Puimedon， 
if network MTU s not 0, dnsmasq of dhcp-agent will set MTU to that of network to force vm interface to be in pace, else dnsmasq will not set constraint on MTU , and MTU of vm interface  will use the default vaule 1500.'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-03-15 13:30:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Question: could u please elaborate why didn't you add the same logic for the nested case [1]?

[1] - https://github.com/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/blob/master/kuryr_kubernetes/cni/binding/nested.py#L61"}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-03-15 13:49:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

another issue for the BM case, we"ll have the Openstack SDN agent running on the node. For east-west traffic, the agent will add tunnel/encapsulation header. so the container's MTU should consider this tunnel/header size.

As far as I remember the 'network_device_mtu' field is deprecated in Nova/Neutron. take a look at [1].
 
[1] https://www.openstack.org/assets/presentation-media/the-notorious-mtu.pdf'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-03-15 16:20:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I agree with Yossi, we should rely on the SDN info and not set our own MTU -- different neutron networks may have different MTUs. In fact, based on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/336805/, maybe we are in trouble if the mtu configuration of the network is changed after the pod is created.'}, {'account_id': 14852, 'date': '2018-03-16 06:57:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks for you comments. 
First of all, this configuration is used for `default` MTU of ther interface of container, and used only when MUT of network is 0.
Than means i normal circumstances, MTU of network is well calculated by neutron m2 plugin based on physical MTU and SDN type, etc.'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-03-16 08:30:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-03-16 08:30:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-03-16 08:44:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 21486, 'date': '2018-03-16 09:40:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14852, 'date': '2018-03-20 03:19:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

should we merge this patch?'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-03-20 09:08:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I would like to have a follow-up patch that sets it depending on the tunneling used, since 1500 is typically too much for vxlan, gre and geneve'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-03-26 18:04:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-03-26 18:04:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Okay, let's merge this and fix tunneling case in follow up patch."}]

commit_message:
fix kury-cni exits unexpectedly when MTU of network is 0

If the MTU of the netowrk of interface is 0,
"Netlink Error, invalid argument" will be raised,
and kury-cni exits unexpectedly.

When mtu is 0,
1. dhcp-option-force of dnsmasq for is not set,
   and mtu of interface of vm is set to be 1500 by default
2. mtu of qvo-xxx and qvb-xxx is set to 1500,
   which is determined by configuration,network_device_mtu.

Fix this by adding default network device MTU configuration,
which is used instead if MTU of network is 0

Change-Id: I7c1140b116aa6304aca13479a7d7eb82d828d16f
Close-Bug: 1738812

We weren't previously branching these projects, but we want to do so
in the future and don't want to rely on the "be careful" method of
stable branch maintenance.  This way we should be able to do
development on Rocky without affecting Queens.

Change-Id: I8fa6950f9cef7c82b00a9e67355aa066042211af
'}]
commit_message:
Add stable/queens branches for devstack-plugin-[amqp1|kafka]

We weren't previously branching these projects, but we want to do so
in the future and don't want to rely on the "be careful" method of
stable branch maintenance.  This way we should be able to do
development on Rocky without affecting Queens.

Change-Id: I8fa6950f9cef7c82b00a9e67355aa066042211af

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I5a5a297c8b16a507a7d2dd65f2d11363d1d238d2
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add a job to run unit tests against the lower bounds of our dependencies

This is part of the migration to stop syncing global requirements into
projects.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2017-12-20 02:49:38.000000000', 'message': 'VNX: fix options incorrect behavior

Since Newton, the following options were incorrectly handled:

max_luns_per_storage_group: this option was igored, and implicitly set
to 255 in storops, thus there is not way to set it to a larger number
for admin. This commit will add this feature back.

check_max_pool_luns_threshold: this option was obsoleted since driver
can detect this value automatically. This commit will remove this
option for driver code.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1738681

Change-Id: If3ca0999a745e6977345f208fc6edd00c86ccea9

commit_message:
VNX: fix options incorrect behavior

Since Newton, the following options were incorrectly handled:

max_luns_per_storage_group: this option was ignored, and implicitly set
to 255 in storops, thus there is not way to set it to a larger number
for admin. This commit will add this feature back.

check_max_pool_luns_threshold: this option was obsoleted since driver
can detect this value automatically. This commit will remove this
option for driver code.

Closes-bug: #1738681

Change-Id: If3ca0999a745e6977345f208fc6edd00c86ccea9

[{'created': '2018-03-13 12:22:46.000000000', 'message': "VMAX driver - Replication failover performance improvement

Currently, failover of synchronous volumes on a VMAX backend can take a
long time as each volume is failed over consecutively. This patch
rectifies the issue by creating an internal group to facilitate the use
of group API's in the backend instead of volume API's, meaning the
volumes can failed-over concurrently.

Change-Id: Ie805c680662c160b77afcef47a3e0443bf1b15ef
Closes-bug: 1747894
"}, {'created': '2018-03-13 12:24:19.000000000', 'message': "VMAX driver - Replication failover performance improvement

Currently, failover of synchronous volumes on a VMAX backend can take a
long time as each volume is failed over consecutively. This patch
rectifies the issue by creating an internal group to facilitate the use
of group API's in the backend instead of volume API's, meaning the

Change-Id: Ie805c680662c160b77afcef47a3e0443bf1b15ef
Closes-bug: 1747894

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Replication failover performance improvement

Currently, failover of synchronous volumes on a VMAX backend can take a
long time as each volume is failed over consecutively. This patch
rectifies the issue by creating an internal group to facilitate the use
of group API's in the backend instead of volume API's, meaning the
volumes can failed-over concurrently.

Change-Id: Ie805c680662c160b77afcef47a3e0443bf1b15ef
Closes-bug: 1747894

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ib7f87445039e8e71edbe52b985c632bc4da29174
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2018-03-25 10:59:54.000000000', 'message': 'Use the correct version for vmware-nsxlib

Align vmware-nsxlib with the neutron projects. This should be

Change-Id: Ie8679035078fa62e6c77609039a76098d8824752
'}, {'created': '2018-03-26 05:22:16.000000000', 'message': 'Use the correct version for vmware-nsxlib

Align vmware-nsxlib with the neutron projects. This should be
>=12.0.0. The nsxlib has features that were developed in the
Queens cycle and these are required when using vmware-nsx
12.0.0 and above.

More specifically vmware-nsx and vmware-nsxlib need to make
use of the same major version, either 11.x or 12.y. Having
a mismatch in the requirements is problematic and break the
CI.

Change-Id: Ie8679035078fa62e6c77609039a76098d8824752
'}]
commit_message:
Use the correct version for vmware-nsxlib

Align vmware-nsxlib with the neutron projects. This should be
>=12.0.0. The nsxlib has features that were developed in the
Queens cycle and these are required when using vmware-nsx
12.0.0 and above.

More specifically vmware-nsx and vmware-nsxlib need to make
use of the same major version, either 11.x or 12.y. Having
a mismatch in the requirements is problematic and break the
CI.

Change-Id: Ie8679035078fa62e6c77609039a76098d8824752

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-02-14 11:04:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

It's exactly the path I don't want for quickstart to go, before it turns to be second "tripleo-ci" in its last days, non maintainable, not readable, with a lot of hacks, raw code and without any general design. 

I don't want to block this, but I also don't want to take any responsibility for maintaining this code, fixing it, monitoring it or dealing with it in any way. When something is broken in prep-containers role I immediately call for DF people to check and fix it.

Deal?'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-02-14 11:51:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-02-14 13:21:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Prep containers tasks are used to have good coverage via existing CI jobs. Introduced regressions should be caught with generic CI checks I suppose. The plan is to remove code duplication and use the role for undercloud and overcloud cases, "we'll make them as one script". revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 21:04:27.000000000', 'message': "prep-containers: include containerized undercloud bits

This is part of the efforts of using the same prep-containers role for
both the containerized undercloud & overcloud.

This patch move the command run in previous
undercloud-prep-containers.sh to the new prep-containers.sh.

In the case of a scenario where both undercloud & overcloud are
containerized, the commands will be run twice, but we'll tweak it so we
can run only once and make it easier.

Therefore, we remove any prep-containers tasks from undercloud-deploy
role.

Change-Id: I3357a35a49af6f6a1b59ee7103cf01fcb992a1fa

"}, {'created': '2018-02-12 19:13:36.000000000', 'message': "prep-containers: include containerized undercloud bits

This is part of the efforts of using the same prep-containers role for
both the containerized undercloud & overcloud.

This patch refactorize the prep-containers to use 2 scripts:
* prep-containers-undercloud.sh
* prep-containers-overcloud.sh

In the future, we'll make it one script, so the end users will be able
to run a single command to prepare the containers, but for now it's
possible.

In the case of a scenario where both undercloud & overcloud are
containerized, the commands will be run twice, but we'll tweak it so we
can run only once and make it easier.

Therefore, we remove any prep-containers tasks from undercloud-deploy
role.

Change-Id: I3357a35a49af6f6a1b59ee7103cf01fcb992a1fa

commit_message:
prep-containers: include containerized undercloud bits

This is part of the efforts of using the same prep-containers role for
both the containerized undercloud & overcloud.

This patch refactors the prep-containers to use 2 scripts:
* prep-containers-undercloud.sh
* prep-containers-overcloud.sh

In the future, we'll make them as one script, so the end users will be able
to run a single command to prepare the containers, but for now it's not
possible.

In the case of a scenario where both undercloud & overcloud are
containerized, the commands will be run twice, but we'll tweak it so we
can run only once and make it easier.

Therefore, we remove any prep-containers tasks from undercloud-deploy
role.

Closes-Bug: #1749607
Co-authored-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3357a35a49af6f6a1b59ee7103cf01fcb992a1fa

I don't remember where, but some time in the past couple of months I ran into this very problem with python-requests as well :-)

(`verify` is a pretty eccentric kind of parameter: it's a...hmm...ternary boolean. Which means it can be True (verify from system certificates), False _and_ a path to a non-system certificate to verify against. I remember this amusing situation biting me _somewhere_ previously...)"}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-02-27 19:27:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-02-27 19:30:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Looking quickly at monasca-ui, I don't see any existing tests related to testing different settings (all seem to use the same settings.py), so that may need to be written."}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-03-12 19:17:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I am wondering can @Witold add the some initial api tests and I will add test related to the changes?"}, {'account_id': 26733, 'date': '2018-03-12 20:54:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Fixed the problem for SSL certificate access failure

When specify OPENSTACK_SSL_NO_VERIFY = False, monascaclient
throws an exception when access alarms, alarm definitions
and notifictions.  Changed parameter cert to verify so it
takes boolean or passes the certificate file.

Also added unit tests for api.client

Story: 2001601
Task: 6555

Change-Id: Ib068bdc3fae1ebdb2bda8d7b6c24a725cef5b24b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/550130

commit_message:
Add devstack-plugin-[amqp1|kafka] projects

We want to start branching these so the stable branches aren't using
the master devstack plugin.  Note that the other two existing
devstack plugins for oslo.messaging (pika and zmq) are slated for
removal so they are omitted on purpose.

Change-Id: I3c98fb64f04149c52dd75999fe89221b4fb14336

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 20:26:22.000000000', 'message': "roles: rename overcloud-prep-containers to prep-containers

With the containerized undercloud, we're going to re-use what has been
done for the overcloud.

This patch is one of the initiatives to re-use the same workflow to
prepare the host for containerized deployments.

It renames the overcloud-prep-containers role to be prep-containers,
remove references (when possible) to the overcloud and keep
overcloud-prep-containers around which will include the tasks from
prep-containers for backward compatibility.

Change-Id: Ice14c641a16ac0b809e516f28054a0176bb44a9b

commit_message:
roles: rename overcloud-prep-containers to prep-containers

With the containerized undercloud, we're going to re-use what has been
done for the overcloud.

This patch is one of the initiatives to re-use the same workflow to
prepare the host for containerized deployments.
It renames the overcloud-prep-containers role to be prep-containers,
remove references (when possible) to the overcloud and keep
overcloud-prep-containers around which will include the tasks from
prep-containers for backward compatibility.

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I0c0ecafd9f600869accabe3c8195d40767f21341
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

in those tests.

commit_message:
Fix pep8 for config_template.py

Gate tests will fail until we fix pep8 for config_template.py
This PR fixes the config_template module for pep8 compliance,
follows the latest PTI for docs compliance,
and re-enables the linters.

Change-Id: Ic288b462a53ac45983f47f29a7d5d8d48d0b9c0b
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>

commit_message:
Release os-brick 2.4.0

This releases os-brick 2.4.0 to get a number of
bug fixes released and to also add a couple of new features.
The first feature is the ability for ScaleIO to extend
attached volumes.  It also adds support for SMBFS mounting
vhd/x images.

Given the feature changes this bumps os-brick from
2.3.0 to 2.4.0.

Change-Id: I2889476829629ac0494fc9ed339ddb4a5957438b

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I50af6344c8de6fae3602e6d0f5267623ce492dc9
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I70508df7928e38fd8b97e69d42fbde5d9b17ad16
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix api-ref: nova image-meta is deprecated from 2.39

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#create-image-metadata
says "These will fail with a 404 starting from microversion 2.36",
but https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id35
says "2.39 Deprecates image-metadata proxy API", the system's
actual behaviour is that image-metadata proxy API will fail
with 404 starting from microversion 2.39, so this is to
fix the api-ref.

Change-Id: I159e5de59a228fde6c7a0647d3726ad3025b67ed

commit_message:
Remove usage of ordereddict

This was only needed for Python < 2.7, but glanceclient's setup.cfg
already declares compatibility only with 2.7.

Change-Id: I80d42abf5dd5565da424a90a93545ba82ef7a58d

commit_message:
Add db layer support for node fault

Currently, ironic's API and data model make no differentiation between
ironic setting maintenance on a node and an operator setting maintenance
on a node.

Node fault support introduces fault management to ironic, cases of
maintenance mode set by ironic will be replaced by a specific fault.

This patch implements db layer support for this feature.

Change-Id: I9a60ee3399dc5efe600834b5c0486aa08a3df665
Partial-Bug: #1596107

commit_message:
update parse test to use reliable comparison

Different versions of setuptools seem to produce
different representations of the version specifiers,
so use pkg_resources to parse the values again
and then compare the resulting objects so we
aren't tripped up by rendering differences.

Change-Id: Ic67cc936208dbd96b6d811c6aa284fd87df5b118
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Closes-Bug: #1758877

this way we can add in the JWT tokens when they land without having to redo all the conditional logic here'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2018-03-06 16:55:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Have we already deprecated the support of the UUID token provider?'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2018-03-06 16:56:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

deprecation matters not when its been removed from the keystone code base'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-03-08 03:21:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Since JWT will be implemented in this cycle, i am agree with sam to keep the current logical for futur usage.

But the other patch is not enough too, it should remove the uuid token in configuration files too.

@egonzalez could you sync with mark to abandon one of the two patches and work togather?'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-03-26 15:49:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Remove support for keystone UUID tokens

UUID tokens are removed in keystone in rocky release.
Only supported token provider is fernet

Change-Id: I33fbf3ba15cb1fe10d4b75830d00d1be6f711b5f

[{'created': '2017-05-14 15:09:49.000000000', 'message': 'Remove hardcoded eth0 MASQUERADE rule

Any data that should be masqueraded will be masqueraded
by the following rule which is earlier in the chain.

  iptables -t nat-A BOOTSTACK_MASQ_NEW -s $NETWORK ! -d $NETWORK -j MASQUERADE

Closes-Bug: #1690584
Change-Id: Ic30b24959ca3259974160abcfa213e6a14c953f5
'}]
commit_message:
Remove hardcoded eth0 MASQUERADE rule

Any data that should be masqueraded will be masqueraded
by the following rule which is earlier in the chain.

  iptables -t nat-A BOOTSTACK_MASQ_NEW -s $NETWORK ! -d $NETWORK -j MASQUERADE

Closes-Bug: #1690584
Change-Id: Ic30b24959ca3259974160abcfa213e6a14c953f5

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

Add missing dev packages for libxml and libxslt to the bindep config
file.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I4a51633916661bdfa926eb231b8e482628887e90
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate the action parameter for fencing generation.

We can no longer pass the action parameter to Pacemaker due to
deprecation in recent releases, nor should we ever have offered the
parameter in the first place.

Change-Id: I6a9de20114df7f6779fa0759528ec25c343786d6
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/550028
Closes-Bug: #1753728
(cherry picked from commit 7eaee1b2aa71ef9c6b834746d79b6d521dfdf096)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-25 14:13:17.000000000', 'message': 'Remove fence_action parameter from GenerateFencingParametersAction

We no longer accept a fence_action parameter - it was a mistake to add
it in the first place (it overrides all actions used with Pacemaker, so
even simple status requests can reboot/poweroff a node) and has now been
officially deprecated by Pacemaker, which causes deployments to fail.

Change-Id: I45e08964b69552eb5b7954278cfe72a5a59e2f8d
Closes-Bug: #1753728
(cherry picked from commit 69b4962d94ca0d3fb1ba3c1033a550c1b95060fd)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove fence_action parameter from GenerateFencingParametersAction

We no longer accept a fence_action parameter - it was a mistake to add
it in the first place (it overrides all actions used with Pacemaker, so
even simple status requests can reboot/poweroff a node) and has now been
officially deprecated by Pacemaker, which causes deployments to fail.

Change-Id: I45e08964b69552eb5b7954278cfe72a5a59e2f8d
Closes-Bug: #1753728
(cherry picked from commit 69b4962d94ca0d3fb1ba3c1033a550c1b95060fd)
