messages: [{'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-03-26 09:12:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-03-26 10:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-03-26 12:17:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-26 09:12:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add pre_upgrade_rolling_tasks

The resultin pre_upgrade_rolling_steps_playbook will be executed in a
node-by-node rolling fashion at the beginning of major upgrade
workflow (before upgrade_steps_playbook).

The current intended use case is special handling of L3 agent upgrade
when moving Neutron services into containers. Special care needs to be
taken in this case to preserve L3 connectivity of instances (with
regard to dnsmasq and keepalived sub-processes of L3 agent).

The playbook can be run before the main upgrade like this:

openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles overcloud --playbook pre_upgrade_rolling_steps_playbook.yaml

Partial-Bug: #1738768
Change-Id: Icb830f8500bb80fd15036e88fcd314bf2c54445d
Implements: blueprint major-upgrade-workflow
(cherry picked from commit ae085825e22cb4ce7bf877087c2e324b8bec1f03)
'}]
commit_message:
Add pre_upgrade_rolling_tasks

The resultin pre_upgrade_rolling_steps_playbook will be executed in a
node-by-node rolling fashion at the beginning of major upgrade
workflow (before upgrade_steps_playbook).

The current intended use case is special handling of L3 agent upgrade
when moving Neutron services into containers. Special care needs to be
taken in this case to preserve L3 connectivity of instances (with
regard to dnsmasq and keepalived sub-processes of L3 agent).

The playbook can be run before the main upgrade like this:

openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles overcloud --playbook pre_upgrade_rolling_steps_playbook.yaml

Partial-Bug: #1738768
Change-Id: Icb830f8500bb80fd15036e88fcd314bf2c54445d
Implements: blueprint major-upgrade-workflow
(cherry picked from commit ae085825e22cb4ce7bf877087c2e324b8bec1f03)

commit_message:
Fixing v1 Dashboard

This patch fixes incompatibles with both Horizon and Django, and
without this patch, it is not possible to use the v1 dashboard with the
Horizon pike release.

- Use openstack_dashboard.api.neutron instead of openstack_dashboard.api.network
- Made action_present and action_past callable.
- Fixed compatibility issues with Django.
- Removed unused import.

Change-Id: Iaa37f1ef90ee3188c7099a0accdf372191f8f509
(cherry picked from commit 7b09cc4d0488ccc47dcfed55c6849282c9364d64)
Closes-Bug: #1754268

Looks good - simple fix that fixes a clear typo.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-13 05:15:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm not convinced this is acceptable to backport.  On the surface this would break upgrades but the commit message "policy was missed" indicates that it's part of a larger effort/ rename with designate.

Can you provide a little more context so I can evaluate this change in the context of the stable-policy/upgrades?'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-03-13 06:12:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I'm not convinced this is acceptable to backport.  On the surface
 > this would break upgrades but the commit message "policy was
 > missed" indicates that it's part of a larger effort/ rename with
 > designate.
 > 
 > Can you provide a little more context so I can evaluate this change
 > in the context of the stable-policy/upgrades?

So this patch does not actually change any of the actual application logic. It just changes the logic of the policy generation, and example policy file. 

The actual check was always using update_service_status, and never update_service_service_status.
https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/dd611a025e05863d922620981ae8c0f8c6cc49d6/designate/central/service.py#L2888'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-13 08:59:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fix policy name

The `update_service_status` policy was missed
named as `update_service_service_status` which seemed
to cause issues for other rules.

Closes-Bug: #1753503

Change-Id: Ic2952c36c03a4cb7a148f1518766ddefb9144dcd
(cherry picked from commit 54be325783513aa472fd78f3c29ed5ffaae598c0)

commit_message:
Ceph backup: eventlet.green.subprocess replace subprocess

When I use subprocess.Popen to create a large volume in backup/
drivers/ceph.py , it may take more than a few minutes to compute,
meanwhile, cinder-backup service status is down.
In this patch, I use eventlet.green.subprocess replace subprocess,
it can do other tasks while a backup is created, in the same time
cinder-backup service status is reported an its status is up.

Closes-Bug:1692775

Change-Id: Iacf963d6e7c7cbfebaa9c9d4dda89dffa34180a2

commit_message:
Reload AppArmor when policies are changed

AppArmor needs to be reloaded when new policies are written, not only
when the 'aa-profile-mode' config option is changed.

Change-Id: Ia2990cdc03f6fa0d3a38e4a3247422f0950ee0eb
Closes-Bug: 1755823
(cherry picked from commit 6ad15f94edcf32601c0163412b8e5f66ea265939)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ic0e992533d1b5840e665aa1a5a311c3e1b0d74e8
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Log config options with oslo.config

This removes some custom code inherited from Cinder which was handling
the output of secret options in a bad way. This patch utilizes Oslo's
existing utilities to output the Manila configuration options securely.

Filtering will be done with the "secret=True" option flag.

Major thanks to Eric Harney for introducing this fix to Cinder.

Change-Id: I894e011680661c0b73b9592f70a6457e403f18c6
Related-Bug: #1750074
(cherry picked from commit 3d7909deb21a1f0be4cd6eca13dc9e8d070f71e2)
(cherry picked from commit 1949b403e9feb134d0fb2b9d65271292277351ee)
(cherry picked from commit 19aeba1f63f4e864eebda61bf16a078055c79cb0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-20 16:14:30.000000000', 'message': "Raise an error if deployment_name cannot be determined

Parameter deployment_name should be set via the name property on
the Deployment resources in the templates, however, if it's None,
it will be defaulted to the name of the parent_resource.
for resources such as ExtraConfigPost, PreConfig, PostConfig,
there is no default parent resource name which means the
generated ansible group_vars will be an empty string if custom
templates don't contain a name property; this in turn will
cause syntax error when executing ansible playbooks.

This code prevents such situations and raises an error if
the value cannpt be determined.

Change-Id: Ibe884331b5fb9269b796a13beb489e91aeca71ed
Closes-bug: #1755078
"}]
commit_message:
Raise an error if deployment_name cannot be determined

Parameter deployment_name should be set via the name property on
the Deployment resources in the templates, however, if it's None,
it will be defaulted to the name of the parent_resource.
for resources such as ExtraConfigPost, PreConfig, PostConfig,
there is no default parent resource name which means the
generated ansible group_vars will be an empty string if custom
templates don't contain a name property; this in turn will
cause syntax error when executing ansible playbooks.

This code prevents such situations and raises an error if
the value cannpt be determined.

Change-Id: Ibe884331b5fb9269b796a13beb489e91aeca71ed
Closes-bug: #1755078

commit_message:
HAProxy: fix bind mount to expose stats socket

I54b5b59ef49de8d66232312bc449559a7f16eaad configures the HAProxy
service to expose the stats socket with a bind mount, however the
main service container doesn't use that bind mount. Fix that.

Change-Id: I316ab408e82cda70bed8b203b3755936392201da

Add disabled option to create_cell command

Specifying this new option will create pre-disabled cells.

Related to blueprint cell-disable

subject: Add support for Horizon Octavia Dashboard
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 538, 'name': 'Major Hayden', 'email': 'major@mhtx.net', 'username': 'rackerhacker'}, {'_account_id': 819, 'name': 'Adrien Cunin', 'email': 'adrien@adriencunin.fr', 'username': 'adri2000'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 10850, 'name': 'German Eichberger', 'email': 'german.eichberger@gmail.com', 'username': 'german'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 18552, 'name': 'Kevin Lefevre', 'email': 'lefevre.kevin@gmail.com', 'username': 'ArchiFleKs'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23182, 'name': 'kourosh vivan', 'email': 'kourosh.vivan@ovhcloud.com', 'username': 'KouroshVivan'}, {'_account_id': 24468, 'name': 'Limestone Networks CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@limestonenetworks.com', 'username': 'limestone-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 18552, 'date': '2018-02-13 16:50:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18552, 'date': '2018-02-13 16:51:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-02-13 17:39:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

lgtm - please update release notes to warn of duplicate panel/LBs'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-13 22:05:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Patch looks good, but German's comment on the reno is good."}, {'account_id': 18552, 'date': '2018-02-13 22:36:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-14 08:48:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I don't see a problem with that double panel thing, but it might be good to advise one, or the other? I am completely lost, and I am pretty sure I am not the only one."}, {'account_id': 18552, 'date': '2018-02-14 11:12:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I don't see a problem with that double panel thing, but it might be
 > good to advise one, or the other? I am completely lost, and I am
 > pretty sure I am not the only one.

@jp it is bit tricky, LBaaSv2 panel is deployed when LBaaS v2 is in neutron plugin base, and Octavia Dashaboard when Octavia Host is present. 

But it is possible to still deploy octavia with API v1 as a driver of LBaaS v2 a so use the old neutron panel to deploy Octavia Load Balancer.

But the proper way to deploy Octavia is by using the standalone v2 API and remove neutron-lbaas and the panel.

If you keep the two enable you will get two panel.

To sum up (German correct me if I'm wrong) but the scenario are the following:
- Octavia v1 + Neutron LBaaSv2 (so 2 drivers, HAproxy + Octavia) : 2 panel
- Octavia v1 +v2 + Neutron LBaaSv2 : 2 panel
- Octavia v2 with Neutron LBaaSv2 disable : one panel

Maybe we could make the Octavia dashboard a condition on Octavia v2 being enabled? I don't now if Octavia Dashboard works with the Octavia v1 + NeutronLBaaS"}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-02-14 16:27:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Kevin is mostly correct. The disturbing case is:
LBaaS V2 (with Octavia driver enabled) + Octavia V2 API enabled: This will create two panels and worse show the load balancers in both. But if you delete the load balancer in the Octavia panel it will still show up in the LBaaS V2 panel. 

The cases two panels might be ok:
* LBaaS V2 (Octavia driver NOT enabled) + Octavia enabled
* LBaaS V2 with Octavia proxy plugin + Octavia enabled

LBaaS V2 panel only:
LBaaS V2 and not Octavia V2 API active - either by not installing Octavia or disabling it

Octavia panel only:
LBaaS V2 removed + Octavia V2 API active'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-02-14 16:50:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

They pretty much align to the base load balancing package.
If neutron-lbaas is installed, install neutron-lbaas-dashboard.
If octavia v2 API is installed, install octavia-dashboard.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-02-14 17:00:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I will be updating the READMEs in the dashboard projects with guidance so we can point to that and close the discussion here.'}, {'account_id': 18552, 'date': '2018-02-19 09:48:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@German thanks. @Jp can we move forward with this ? Can those patches be backported to queens ?'}, {'account_id': 18552, 'date': '2018-03-22 10:18:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-22 12:50:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-03-22 12:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-03-22 12:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18552, 'date': '2018-03-22 13:04:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-25 06:21:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-25 16:50:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-03-26 10:49:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Add access to /var/run/openvswitch from collectd

container. Otherwise, the collectd-ovs-stats or
collectd-ovs-events plugins won't be able to read stats from
ovs.

Change-Id: I2520a6d25470f144589d957737ae8ac39d3215a2

neutron: add --mtu for create/set network

Support Neutron network mtu configuration with a new argument, --mtu
that allows CLI users to set MTU for Neutron networks.

=========================

The linter started complaining about a relative-import issue with the

This patch fixes the relative-import and disables the

their categorization is incorrect.

and ignored tables that are related but are not managed by us. In
addition, it adds the two missing matches so it does not fail on them.

commit_message:
Fix CI issues that block the gate

This patch is the composition of two different patches:

1. Fix PEP8 pylint errors
=========================

The linter started complaining about a relative-import issue with the
library six. Once that import was fixed it started complaining on a
particular function of the module imported with a
too-many-function-args.

This patch fixes the relative-import and disables the
too-many-function-args locally for that function, as it is a problem
with the library and not a real error.

2. Fix functional migration tests
=================================

The functional migration tests has ignore for tables that are external
and not related to the current repo and now the migration tests started
failing on tables that weren not present in that list. Also, the failing
migrations are indeed external but are also related to the repo, so
their categorization is incorrect.

This patch separates between external that are not related to the repo
and ignored tables that are related but are not managed by us. In
addition, it adds the two missing matches so it does not fail on them.

Change-Id: Ieaad6b61f55f86f54ecc27aae74c3b2495ec6eb5

commit_message:
Make docs on env vars a little clearer

It was pointed out that the packager docs don't make it super obvious
that the env var settings that packagers can set are env vars. Add
export statements to the docs to imply it a bit more that we are talking
about env vars here.

Change-Id: I9e9eefa661994237a63b59dcefab11961ef339e1
Fixes-bug: 1724425

Trailing commas in values of list type caused extra empty elements to be
appended to list values.

Closes-Bug: #1758871
'}]
commit_message:
Support trailing commas in values of list type

Trailing commas in values of list type caused extra empty elements to be
appended to list values.

Strip trailing commas before spliting values to make it more robust.

Change-Id: I6f187c437ccd10779e7b91f2aa60e0487f938b30
Closes-Bug: #1758871

commit_message:
Remove the noop deploystep for upgrade converge step

The noop deploystep is set during the prepare step for
upgrade. It put in the plan_env directly, so since we are
keeping the user-env / plan-env for upgrade the noop
steps are never removed.
This patch aim to trigger a mistral action to remove all
the OS::Heat::None for the deploystep/pre/post

Change-Id: If7eb342a84b530b07db513146e85916f2d5c1370
(cherry picked from commit 426f4aa6d859eda7614cd173974f5ccd32446116)

allow_requeue is for unhandled callback error, if the callback does succeed once it will never ever succeed. Putting back the message to the queue again and again does sound good to me.'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2017-09-29 12:59:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

To be clearer, I think we have to set allow_requeue to have ack_on_event_error working.

But recent oslo.messaging always retry in this case and that weird.'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2017-09-29 13:01:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

So you should also fix this class: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/a07d852b237d229a0f4dd55fd83379c0581e44e9/oslo_messaging/notify/listener.py#L189-L204

To retry only when the return is REQUEUE and not for all messages.'}, {'account_id': 25568, 'date': '2017-09-29 13:22:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > So you should also fix this class: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/a07d852b237d229a0f4dd55fd83379c0581e44e9/oslo_messaging/notify/listener.py#L189-L204
 > 
 > To retry only when the return is REQUEUE and not for all messages.

Mmm maybe I'm wrong but, is it that not what's going on right now due to https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/afaa4d935dd77760492f36dba622f6a01fe14fd9/oslo_messaging/notify/dispatcher.py#L117 ? It only adds those messages that return REQUEUED no?"}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2017-09-29 13:58:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think we should remove this line https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/a07d852b237d229a0f4dd55fd83379c0581e44e9/oslo_messaging/notify/listener.py#L195

to avoid the requeue loop'}, {'account_id': 25568, 'date': '2017-09-29 14:14:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

 > 
 > to avoid the requeue loop

If the problem is in the callback, it never reaches that line. The exception is catched before in: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/afaa4d935dd77760492f36dba622f6a01fe14fd9/oslo_messaging/notify/dispatcher.py#L158'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2017-10-30 15:23:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Allow requeues in when there is a failure in EventsNotificationEndpoint

When `ack_on_event_error` is set to False, it ack's the notification
anyway. The reason behind this is the configuration of the batch
notification listener which doesn't allow requeues

Change-Id: I5511272c4dc2d5759cab8b9e695bbd9ed6a1bf6a
Closes-Bug: #1720329

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ic5f68cd606f5dd17e4cca2facf3141960180be26
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I5cc1e43a64975ffe0d9ca67d0ac3ad98a26f4263

commit_message:
Exclude Ansible 2.5 from driver-reqs

Ansible 2.5 appears to be incompaible with the current
ansible driver interface. Until we've sorted it out,
we should block >=2.5.0 from being installed.

Related-Bug: #1758462

Change-Id: I9c3b2528f8da28554e3eb4e03528517a6c6c326f
(cherry picked from commit b8725e5d2bad6ce069d8cfb67afa88137632286e)

commit_message:
Revert "Prepare t-h-t for undercloud in a work dir"

This patch breaks backward compatibility when
upgrading from a non-containerized undercloud
to a containerized undercloud.

This reverts commit 0b3b55288b85cdf158b90c895dd4c17937d81f3c.

Change-Id: I8a69908a0a1500e5ee2b95d2a3f5ffcc77c84d12

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-25 18:00:56.000000000', 'message': 'Update cinder role SHA for cinder_backends fix

Currently the backend setup executes on the first cinder-api
host. The playbook to execute the setup of the API is done
in serial. This creates a bit of a problem on a greenfield
deployment which uses haproxy because the backend is disabled
and there are no other API hosts setup yet. This makes the
CLI commands which require the API to be working fail.

Given that this is a critical bug, this patch updates the
cinder role to ensure that the fix for this is included in
the next release

Change-Id: I23b966c68b491e51f33c89a1aa196a50c42fe3f4
Closes-Bug: #1753125
'}]
commit_message:
Update cinder role SHA for cinder_backends fix

Currently the backend setup executes on the first cinder-api
host. The playbook to execute the setup of the API is done
in serial. This creates a bit of a problem on a greenfield
deployment which uses haproxy because the backend is disabled
and there are no other API hosts setup yet. This makes the
CLI commands which require the API to be working fail.

Given that this is a critical bug, this patch updates the
cinder role to ensure that the fix for this is included in
the next release

Change-Id: I23b966c68b491e51f33c89a1aa196a50c42fe3f4
Closes-Bug: #1753125

commit_message:
Disable ceph-ansible NTP installation

ceph-ansible installs ntp by default, which conflicts with the OSA
default of enabling ntp via ansible-hardening's chrony
configuration.

Change-Id: I5a1fba202899f4cd0f0598682af44227d2d7a02b
(cherry picked from commit 72a244d994d84b14a722e957d00f0802006ed545)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I6926bee3efd4a457aa524608b93a114f592da275
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-20 13:24:08.000000000', 'message': 'Better tarball upload validation

When creating or updating plans via a tarball, the validation
we had so far only looked at the file extension to determine the
validity of the provided file. As the file extension can be spoofed
by simply renaming the file, a better way is to determine the real
MIME type by looking at the file signature[1]. This patch implements
that change.

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_signature

Change-Id: Idd3f4e7f83f2ff03fa8c90373acac4d6828ed81e
'}]
commit_message:
Better tarball upload validation

When creating or updating plans via a tarball, the validation
we had so far only looked at the file extension to determine the
validity of the provided file. As the file extension can be spoofed
by simply renaming the file, a better way is to determine the real
MIME type by looking at the file signature[1]. This patch implements
that change.

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_signature

Change-Id: Idd3f4e7f83f2ff03fa8c90373acac4d6828ed81e

commit_message:
Drop deprecated settings

- HORIZON_IMAGES_ALLOW_UPLOAD (deprecated in Newton)
- CUSTOM_THEME_PATH (deprecated in Mitaka)
- DEFAULT_THEME_PATH (deprecated in Mitaka)
- OPENSTACK_TOKEN_HASH_ENABLED (deprecated in Mitaka)
- TOKEN_DELETION_DISABLED
  (not documented but it was marked as deprecated in Ocata
   in django-openstack-auth commit 5810f9c6)

The related logics related to dropped deprecated settings
have been dropped too.

- custom_path and default_path of get_available_themes() were
  dropped as they are no longer needed in favor of
  the removal of CUSTOM_THEME_PATH and DEFAULT_THEME_PATH.
- Unused remove_project_cache(), is_token_deletion_disabled()
  and delete_token() have been dropped.

Change-Id: Ic9406623cc092884c4136f78fb967b129bfda487

commit_message:
Modify nova-manage cell_v2 list_cells to display "disabled" column

This patch adds the new column disabled to the list of columns to be
displayed by the list_cells command.

Related to blueprint cell-disable

Change-Id: I96a6d5e59d33c65314fc187c0286ce3408d30bdc

The task run un-conditionally and the shell script

Change-Id: I782bc40a6ce192b705d7d08a578fdf6275b9a13e

commit_message:
Allow to run tests outside openstack infra

The task run un-conditionally and the shell script
just echo empty strings which are then used for
ALL the deploys, breaking up deployments with wrong
repo urls.

Change-Id: I782bc40a6ce192b705d7d08a578fdf6275b9a13e
(cherry picked from commit 17439c210cfdf1b22980cb68db3d29dbb41963eb)

commit_message:
Disable ceph-ansible NTP installation

ceph-ansible installs ntp by default, which conflicts with the OSA
default of enabling ntp via ansible-hardening's chrony
configuration.

Change-Id: I5a1fba202899f4cd0f0598682af44227d2d7a02b
(cherry picked from commit 72a244d994d84b14a722e957d00f0802006ed545)

commit_message:
undercloud: workaround for masquerading network in CI/OVB

Full context: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1756183

This code aims to:
- configure basic masquerade network iptables rules
- be temporary until routed networks is properly ported in
  tripleoclient.
- be technical debt and will be cleanup as soon as possible.

Co-authored-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic8c9c6d3f30d9a37a0b3e0904c1bc7a6b35b32a3
Related-Bug: #1756183

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-26 10:47:38.000000000', 'message': "tests: Change order of parsing

Seems setuptools 36.2.0 changed how it outputs requirements in
'{package}.egg-info/requires.txt' files. Our test is hardcoded to check
for this so said test must be updated. We also ensure that older
versions of setuptools will no longer be used to prevent regressions.

Change-Id: Ia4d8c48f84225a0069ed67f74003b0cee1f7b855
Closes-Bug: #1758877
"}]
commit_message:
tests: Change order of parsing

Seems setuptools 36.2.0 changed how it outputs requirements in
'{package}.egg-info/requires.txt' files. Our test is hardcoded to check
for this so said test must be updated. We also ensure that older
versions of setuptools will no longer be used to prevent regressions.

Change-Id: Ia4d8c48f84225a0069ed67f74003b0cee1f7b855
Closes-Bug: #1758877

subject: Make unstable functional test non-voting
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-26 09:55:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-26 09:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27143, 'date': '2018-03-26 10:00:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-03-26 10:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-03-26 12:19:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-26 09:55:37.000000000', 'message': 'Make unstable functional test non-voting

Given that the functional build for this repo
rarely passes and the repo itself is only
maintained by those who use it, we can set the
functional test to non-voting in order to allow
general pattern changes to be implemented
without delay.

This does mean that reviewers applying functional
changes will have to be disciplined about checking
the results, but I think that is OK in this case.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556253
Change-Id: I1a236b88a8c80d82f162a92f6cdfeb9368b6eea7
(cherry picked from commit f3713f98f5663e3aebd1b4e0158a90fbdc45d648)
'}, {'created': '2018-03-26 09:55:57.000000000', 'message': 'Make unstable functional test non-voting

commit_message:
Make unstable functional test non-voting

Given that the functional build for this repo
rarely passes and the repo itself is only
maintained by those who use it, we can set the
functional test to non-voting in order to allow
general pattern changes to be implemented
without delay.

This does mean that reviewers applying functional
changes will have to be disciplined about checking
the results, but I think that is OK in this case.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556279
Change-Id: I1a236b88a8c80d82f162a92f6cdfeb9368b6eea7
(cherry picked from commit f3713f98f5663e3aebd1b4e0158a90fbdc45d648)

commit_message:
Skip the install of documentation files from rpm

This reduces the overall size of the kolla images by 3 percents and
improves the build and push time by 5 percents according to my
measurements.

Compare results with [1] and without [2] the patch applied.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/707910/
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/707907/

Change-Id: I4932b6760af5b5eef9ec79b54b4b2f06eb2a4784

commit_message:
Add osc-placement-dsvm-functional-py3 job

This adds a py3 variant of the functional dsvm job.
This still uses devstack-gate (not native zuulv3) because
I'm not yet cool enough to know how to do native zuulv3 things.

Swift has to be disabled since it doesn't support py3 (this is
something all other py3 jobs are doing right now too).

Change-Id: I9a0074d9658eab76b7c73b820f498d61b89545e7

commit_message:
Make unstable functional test non-voting

Given that the functional build for this repo
rarely passes and the repo itself is only
maintained by those who use it, we can set the
functional test to non-voting in order to allow
general pattern changes to be implemented
without delay.

This does mean that reviewers applying functional
changes will have to be disciplined about checking
the results, but I think that is OK in this case.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556280
Change-Id: I1a236b88a8c80d82f162a92f6cdfeb9368b6eea7
(cherry picked from commit f3713f98f5663e3aebd1b4e0158a90fbdc45d648)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I6a31da768005238e624e2be3d14a61d5b4c7d1d7

[{'created': '2018-03-25 15:43:11.000000000', 'message': 'add lower-constraints job

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Icf512399edde1c4efd049c1775f4b8676680f9ad
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I6745c8bb84811631dd600de44fff9a5a66d9f648

commit_message:
Add validation-errors-nonfatal and debug into updates job.

These two flags enable running the 'overcloud update prepare'
appending --validation-errors-nonfatal flag, as well as obtaining
more debugging information when running the updates commands [0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/blob/master/defaults/main.yml#L173-L181

Change-Id: I6aecee2159d0bfdacd80c44d5c3987b2f4f7095e

commit_message:
Change default output-dir to be $HOME

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/542875 we created --output-dir with
the default to $HOME/.undercloud-heat-installer which is not backward
compatible when you upgrade from a non-containerized undercloud.

Indeed, it'll fail to re-use the same passwords as the previous
deployment because the undercloud-passwords.conf file is in $HOME.

For backward compatibility, we should keep $HOME as default output_dir,
and allow deployers to override it.

Change-Id: I3b8464a3a2761d6cef319f2a1d08baedc9d8cc3e

commit_message:
Add new setup commands for token keys

This change adds new token_setup and token_rotate commands that uses the
same functionality as fernet_setup and fernet_rotate. These commands are
to move users to a more generic use case.

Change-Id: I118f9a89d28d8ec1ccaf88a90053fa723ef98cff

commit_message:
Bump minimum Django version to 1.11

Horizon has dropped older Django versions less than 1.11 [0][1]
considering Django EOL [2].

django-babel version is bumped to >=0.6.2. 0.6.2 is the latest release
and it is compatible with both Django 1.11 and 2.0.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-February/127421.html
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/551728/
[2] https://www.djangoproject.com/weblog/2015/jun/25/roadmap/

commit_message:
Remove the unnecessary database created when upgrade

run upgrade horizion when enable horizon_backend_database, no need
to create database again, run bootstrap_service.yml is enough.
this patch to remove the unnecessary database created.

Change-Id: Ifadaf7db3c55e98cb102896756c36765ec7fb52a

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build [Updated]

Although Tacker docs move to new docs PTI jobs
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/552046/),
the sphinx is still using legacy pbr runner.

This patch works futher jobs:
- Remove legacy pbr runner, [pbr] section.
- Remove [build_sphinx] section.
as described in:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Change-Id: Ic65ed5ec145fa8a356fe28f86c3a69e3d20ef3c2

[{'created': '2018-03-16 15:23:44.000000000', 'message': "Fix typo and misleading task name for nova-consoleauth

The services for console are installed in the 'Install nova
console/metadata services' task, however, the scheduler
install task misleadingly is named to mention that it installs
consoleauth and tries to run on the nova_consoleauth group
which does not exist.

Change-Id: If7c00cbfe3bd50a3702f86e7348de206b9fa3b95
(cherry picked from commit 581e6e5b8eb7c5f8d269f0d3154adaf12d66dbde)

commit_message:
Fix typo and misleading task name for nova-consoleauth

The services for console are installed in the 'Install nova
console/metadata services' task, however, the scheduler
install task misleadingly is named to mention that it installs
consoleauth and tries to run on the nova_consoleauth group
which does not exist.

Change-Id: If7c00cbfe3bd50a3702f86e7348de206b9fa3b95
(cherry picked from commit 581e6e5b8eb7c5f8d269f0d3154adaf12d66dbde)

We have a script for doing the test repo cloning, we should use
it. The script is synchronized and works well with different
branches, where the tox.ini isn't synchronized, and therefore
can lag, like it is right now, in the branch upgrades.

commit_message:
Fix tests repo cloning

We have a script for doing the test repo cloning, we should use
it. The script is synchronized and works well with different
branches, where the tox.ini isn't synchronized, and therefore
can lag, like it is right now, in the branch upgrades.

Change-Id: Ibb94eb78a028b28e41591c1cd9ee582a225019dc
(cherry picked from commit 571e2f661893fc498f425c5da56e28d85babd50f)

commit_message:
Log config options with oslo.config

This removes some custom code inherited from Cinder which was handling
the output of secret options in a bad way. This patch utilizes Oslo's
existing utilities to output the Manila configuration options securely.

Filtering will be done with the "secret=True" option flag.

Major thanks to Eric Harney for introducing this fix to Cinder.

Change-Id: I894e011680661c0b73b9592f70a6457e403f18c6
Related-Bug: #1750074
(cherry picked from commit 3d7909deb21a1f0be4cd6eca13dc9e8d070f71e2)
(cherry picked from commit 1949b403e9feb134d0fb2b9d65271292277351ee)

commit_message:
Fix tests repo cloning

We have a script for doing the test repo cloning, we should use
it. The script is synchronized and works well with different
branches, where the tox.ini isn't synchronized, and therefore
can lag, like it is right now, in the branch upgrades.

Change-Id: Ibb94eb78a028b28e41591c1cd9ee582a225019dc

subject: fixing Pep8 pylint errors
messages:
[{'account_id': 25587, 'date': '2018-03-19 18:20:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2018-03-20 14:50:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17120, 'date': '2018-03-20 17:20:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

neutron also have these type of imports, instead of disabling too-many-function-arguments in pylint, better solution could be ignoring it in tox ?'}, {'account_id': 25587, 'date': '2018-03-20 18:17:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> neutron also have these type of imports, instead of disabling
 > too-many-function-arguments in pylint, better solution could be
 > ignoring it in tox ?

 i guess it can be ignored in tox, but i did not do it as i wanted yours all perspective on it, plus i found this old bug in nova which was addressing similar kind of problem. 

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1037183'}, {'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2018-03-21 03:54:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

>> neutron also have these type of imports, instead of disabling too-many-function-arguments in pylint, better solution could be ignoring it in tox ?

I think, Disabling too-many-function-arguments does not have anything to do with import. (how does it matter "neutron import" here"?)

>> better solution could be ignoring it in tox

What do you mean by ignoring it in tox, it is pylint how does checking? is my understanding wrong?

May be we can disable checks for functions failing this test. It can be done with # disable <checks-name> .'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-03-21 08:55:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Please whenever committing something, even if it's trivial, put a proper commit message. For reference read the documentation [1].

Also, the solution is not very clean as we don't want to disable that message globally nor the import is a correct one. 

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 17120, 'date': '2018-03-21 15:57:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> >> neutron also have these type of imports, instead of disabling
 > too-many-function-arguments in pylint, better solution could be
 > ignoring it in tox ?
 > 
 > I think, Disabling too-many-function-arguments does not have
 > anything to do with import. (how does it matter "neutron import"
 > here"?)
 > 
 > >> better solution could be ignoring it in tox
 > 
 > What do you mean by ignoring it in tox, it is pylint how does
 > checking? is my understanding wrong?
 > 
 > May be we can disable checks for functions failing this test. It
 > can be done with # disable <checks-name> .

I mean actual neutron also have this http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron/tree/neutron/api/api_common.py and they don't do it this way (like urlparse = urllib.parse) and disable too-many-function-arguments, it must have been taken care of somewhere else !'}, {'account_id': 13912, 'date': '2018-03-21 16:09:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Michel, As i mentioned in previous comment that disabling for a line is possible, what do you think of that idea? and for import thing i will look into it.

thanks manjeet for replying, it was not clear at all from your previous comment.

Agree with Michel that, commit message could be improved then there won't be any confusion. May be you were not aware of disabling functional args at the time of commenting.

Thanks to Michel for providing the link, i will go through it."}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-03-21 16:35:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > >> neutron also have these type of imports, instead of disabling
 > > too-many-function-arguments in pylint, better solution could be
 > > ignoring it in tox ?
 > >
 > > I think, Disabling too-many-function-arguments does not have
 > > anything to do with import. (how does it matter "neutron import"
 > > here"?)
 > >
 > > >> better solution could be ignoring it in tox
 > >
 > > What do you mean by ignoring it in tox, it is pylint how does
 > > checking? is my understanding wrong?
 > >
 > > May be we can disable checks for functions failing this test. It
 > > can be done with # disable <checks-name> .
 > 
 > I mean actual neutron also have this http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron/tree/neutron/api/api_common.py
 > and they don't do it this way (like urlparse = urllib.parse) and
 > disable too-many-function-arguments, it must have been taken care
 > of somewhere else !

they have a fixed pylint version that's way lower'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-03-26 11:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Superseded by https://review.openstack.org/554832'}]

commit_message:
Wire up a --skip-tags parameter for overcloud upgrade run cli

This exposes the --skip-tags which is useful for skipping the
service validations (--skip-tags validation). The expected
format is a comma-separated string for multiple values,
though 'validation' and 'pre-upgrade' are the only currently
supported tags for --skip-tags in the upgrade playbooks. The
full list of tags currently used in tripleo-heat-templates
upgrade_tasks is at [0]

  openstack overcloud upgrade run --nodes foo
                                  --skip-tags validation

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/3eb0c62e47fd1635900913b7f0ebbe134b77c7ad/tools/yaml-validate.py#L167
Change-Id: Ie7fb8d9a388c6d53a31800406b03ddb8ed426401
Depends-On: I8544de64d3307e3dc925c1cecf2d9156e31d25a8
(cherry picked from commit d1c39c15c299ef3f435137d0612a8d8af5b442cc)

Use the pin puddle option to avoid any issues caused by generic latest.

> I'm not sure it's worth to add additional variables here, why not

Because you can't, as those variables[1] are loaded from the release file[2].  This make those variable unmutable, ie there is no way to override them.  That's why we need another mutable variable to select which set of docker_* variable we want.

Does it make more sense ?

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 18:14:38.000000000', 'message': 'Provide a way to change docker registry path during mixed upgrade.

During mixed version upgrade, we want to deploy the overcloud with the
N-1 release docker images and then switch to the N images files.

That review[1] adds the N-1 necessary tags.  That review[2] was an
attempt to use the proper parameter in that role for deployment in the
context of mixed version.  This fails.

Because of the way we load the release file (-e ..), all those
variables have the highest precedence[3] possible and cannot be
overridden.

So this a an attempt to support that use case.  With that new variable
we can now do something like this:

    - name: Prepare for containerized deployment
      hosts: undercloud
      gather_facts: no
      tags:
        - overcloud-prep-containers
      vars:
        want_overcloud_mixed_version: mixed_version
      roles:
        - role: overcloud-prep-containers
          when: containerized_overcloud|bool or containerized_overcloud_upgrade|bool

in the toci-quickstart/playbooks/multinode-overcloud-prep.yml and have
the correct tag during deployment.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537833/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539920/
[3] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/playbooks_variables.html#variable-precedence-where-should-i-put-a-variable

Change-Id: I4df06c8a0d5d8133ba64c38b90cef34793776422

initial overcloud deployment.

'}, {'created': '2018-02-12 11:10:52.000000000', 'message': 'Provide a way to change docker registry path during mixed upgrade.

During mixed version upgrade, we want to deploy the overcloud with the
N-1 release docker images and then switch to the N images files.

That review[1] adds the N-1 necessary tags.  That review[2] was an
attempt to use the proper parameter in that role for deployment in the
context of mixed version.  This fails.

Because of the way we load the release file (-e ..), all those
variables have the highest precedence[3] possible and cannot be
overridden.

So this a an attempt to support that use case.  With that new variable
we can now do something like this:

    - name: Prepare for containerized deployment
      hosts: undercloud
      gather_facts: no
      tags:
        - overcloud-prep-containers
      vars:
        want_overcloud_mixed_version: mixed_version
      roles:
        - role: overcloud-prep-containers
          when: containerized_overcloud|bool or containerized_overcloud_upgrade|bool

in the toci-quickstart/playbooks/multinode-overcloud-prep.yml and have
the correct tag during deployment.

Furthermore we use this flag to prevent container upgrade during
initial overcloud deployment.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537833/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539920/1/toci-quickstart/playbooks/multinode-overcloud-prep.yml
[3] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/playbooks_variables.html#variable-precedence-where-should-i-put-a-variable

Related-Bug: #1745348

'}, {'created': '2018-02-23 17:57:08.000000000', 'message': 'Provide a way to change docker registry path during mixed upgrade.

During mixed version upgrade, we want to deploy the overcloud with the
N-1 release docker images and then switch to the N images files.

That review[1] added the N-1 necessary tags.  That review[2] was an
attempt to use the proper parameters in that role for deployment in the
context of mixed version.  This fails.

The failure comes from the fact that we load the release file using
"-e ". All those variables then have the highest precedence[3]
possible and cannot be overridden.

Furthermore we use this `use_overcloud_mixed_upgrade` flags to prevent
the yum upgrade to run inside container during initial overcloud
deployment.  The problem here is that the repo configuration is taken
from the undercloud which is N.  Thus the N-1 images are upgraded to
N.  That means that we can't gate "from" patches.  In a p->q setup, a
change in pike cannot be tested if it relates to the docker image.

Eventually we need a way to sometime only render the container setup
script file which will be consumed by tripleo-upgrade and sometime
run it from oooq directly.  This is what `prep_container_upgrade_run`
is for.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537833/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539920/1/toci-quickstart/playbooks/multinode-overcloud-prep.yml
[3] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/playbooks_variables.html#variable-precedence-where-should-i-put-a-variable

Related-Bug: #1745348

This Tech-debt is introduced until the refactor of the release loading
is done.
Related-Bug: #1749978

Change-Id: I4df06c8a0d5d8133ba64c38b90cef34793776422
'}, {'created': '2018-02-23 18:17:19.000000000', 'message': 'Provide a way to change docker registry path during mixed upgrade.

During mixed version upgrade, we want to deploy the overcloud with the
N-1 release docker images and then switch to the N images files.

That review[1] added the N-1 necessary tags.  That review[2] was an
attempt to use the proper parameters in that role for deployment in the
context of mixed version.  This fails.

The failure comes from the fact that we load the release file using
"-e ". All those variables then have the highest precedence[3]
possible and cannot be overridden.

Furthermore we use this `use_overcloud_mixed_upgrade` flags to prevent
the yum upgrade to run inside container during initial overcloud
deployment.  The problem here is that the repo configuration is taken
from the undercloud which is N.  Thus the N-1 images are upgraded to
N.  That means that we can't gate "from" patches.  In a p->q setup, a
change in pike cannot be tested if it relates to the docker image.

Eventually we need a way to run the container role even when the
containerized_overcloud is false.  For Fast Forward Upgrade, the
starting point is Newton which doesn't use container.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537833/

deployment.  The problem here is that the repo configuration is taken
from the undercloud which is N.  Thus the N-1 images are upgraded to
N.  That means that we can't gate "from" patches.  In a p->q setup, a
change in pike cannot be tested if it relates to the docker image.

Eventually we need a way to run the container role even when the
containerized_overcloud is false.  For Fast Forward Upgrade, the
starting point is Newton which doesn't use container.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537833/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539920/1/toci-quickstart/playbooks/multinode-overcloud-prep.yml
[3] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/playbooks_variables.html#variable-precedence-where-should-i-put-a-variable

Related-Bug: #1745348

This Tech-debt is introduced until the refactor of the release loading
is done.

'}, {'created': '2018-03-05 11:42:57.000000000', 'message': 'Provide a way to change docker registry path during mixed upgrade.

During mixed version upgrade, we want to deploy the overcloud with the
N-1 release docker images and then switch to the N images files.

That review[1] added the N-1 necessary tags.  That review[2] was an
attempt to use the proper parameters in that role for deployment in the
context of mixed version.  This fails.

The failure comes from the fact that we load the release file using
"-e ". All those variables then have the highest precedence[3]
possible and cannot be overridden.

Furthermore we use this `use_overcloud_mixed_upgrade` flags to prevent
the yum upgrade to run inside container during initial overcloud
deployment.  The problem here is that the repo configuration is taken
from the undercloud which is N.  Thus the N-1 images are upgraded to
N.  That means that we can't gate "from" patches.  In a p->q setup, a
change in pike cannot be tested if it relates to the docker image.

Eventually we need a way to run the container role even when the
containerized_overcloud is false.  For Fast Forward Upgrade, the
starting point is Newton which doesn't use container.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537833/

commit_message:
Add support to mixed upgrade for overcloud-prep-container role.

During mixed version upgrade, we want to deploy the overcloud with the
N-1 release docker images and then switch to the N release images
file.

That review[1] added the N-1 necessary tags.  That review[2] was an
attempt to use the proper parameters in that role for deployment in the
context of mixed version.  This fails.

The failure comes from the fact that we load the release file using
"-e ". All those variables then have the highest precedence[3]
possible and cannot be overridden.

Furthermore we use `use_overcloud_mixed_upgrade` flag to prevent the
yum upgrade to run inside container during initial overcloud
deployment.  The problem here is that the repo configuration is taken
from the undercloud which is N.  Thus the N-1 images are upgraded to
N.  That means that we can't gate "from" patches.  In a p->q setup, a
change in pike cannot be tested if it relates to the docker image.

Eventually we need a way to run the container role even when the
containerized_overcloud is false.  For Fast Forward Upgrade, the
starting point is Newton which doesn't use container.  So we introduce
`prep_container_upgrade_run` flag that can be set from the featureset
to ensure that the container get deployed during upgrade.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537833/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539920/1/toci-quickstart/playbooks/multinode-overcloud-prep.yml
[3] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/playbooks_variables.html#variable-precedence-where-should-i-put-a-variable

Related-Bug: #1745348

This Tech-debt is introduced until the refactor of the release loading
is done.
Related-Bug: #1749978

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-28 06:54:46.000000000', 'message': 'Adding suffix into prep-containers log and script.

Upgrading from P->Q will imply
running the overcloud-prep-containers
role twice. As the name used in the
script and log are the same, the second
time the role will run will overwrite
both files from the first one.

This patch adds an option to include
a suffix into the script and log name
which defaults to '', and when a value
is passed it will be appended into the
log and script names.
Example: (suffix="_tripleo")
overcloud_prep_containers_tripleo.sh
overcloud_prep_containers_tripleo.log

Change-Id: I7952872b110b25f67d66de0c5ea4610bfb0f0cb1
'}, {'created': '2018-03-23 11:27:47.000000000', 'message': "Parametrize overcloud-prep-containers script name.

Upgrading from P->Q will imply running the
overcloud-prep-containers role twice. As the
name used in the script is fix, the second
time the role will run will overwrite the
previous script file, which could be useful
for debugging purposes.

This patch adds a new parameter
'overcloud_prep_containers_script' which sets
the name of the script used to configure the
docker containers.

Change-Id: I7952872b110b25f67d66de0c5ea4610bfb0f0cb1
"}]
commit_message:
Parametrize overcloud-prep-containers script name.

Upgrading from P->Q will imply running the
overcloud-prep-containers role twice. As the
name used in the script is fix, the second
time the role will run will overwrite the
previous script file, which could be useful
for debugging purposes.

This patch adds a new parameter
'overcloud_prep_containers_script' which sets
the name of the script used to configure the
docker containers.

Change-Id: I7952872b110b25f67d66de0c5ea4610bfb0f0cb1

commit_message:
Ensure python/paths are updated if folder was not present

In the situation where a deployer may have removed the venv folder
on the target host, but has not removed the the tgz/checksum file,
the venv will get extracted, but the python/paths will not get
updated.

This patch ensures that if the venv folder was not there and gets
created by the task then it will also update the python/paths.

Change-Id: I8858e16a8c128e7d7f44c5e46dc8520aa5bc835b

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I8765d06fe941ddb967963faf8bb324fc8d87e306

To keep the consistency, using http_client.ACCEPTED instead
of 202 and using http_client.NO_CONTENT instead of 204

subject: install-guide: install from the stable branch
messages:
[{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-03-24 02:12:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2018-03-25 04:58:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I wonder if this is the way to handle it. This way such change will be required for any coming stable branch. Maybe the guide should just suggest use the current branch?'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-03-25 17:28:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I wonder if this is the way to handle it. This way such change will
 > be required for any coming stable branch. Maybe the guide should
 > just suggest use the current branch?

Yes, this requires a change right after the cutting of each stable branch. The amount of work is one patch per release (6 months) which is trivial. You can count on me to maintain it if you want.

Note that the openstack installation guide is branched per release and each branch will suggest users to install a stable version of the projects. What this patch suggests is to align kuryr-libnetwork with other OpenStack projects. If we suggest to use current branch of kuryr-libnetwork and install it into the stable/queens stack, it will potentially run into comparability issues due to requirements conflict.'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2018-03-26 06:26:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-03-26 09:56:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-24 02:12:09.000000000', 'message': 'install-guide: install from the stable branch

In the stable/queens version of installation guide, we should
instruct users to git clone the stable/queens branch of
kuryr-libnetwork. This will install the stable version of
kuryr-libnetwork.

Change-Id: I775d61c1c59f865c1e7c7840196cced3408872a7
'}]
commit_message:
install-guide: install from the stable branch

In the stable/queens version of installation guide, we should
instruct users to git clone the stable/queens branch of
kuryr-libnetwork. This will install the stable version of
kuryr-libnetwork.

Change-Id: I775d61c1c59f865c1e7c7840196cced3408872a7

commit_message:
Fix typos in help text of Generic driver and ZFSSA config opts

Change 'the serviceinstance' to 'the service instance' in opts
 "Path to the x509 certificate used for accessing the service
 instance."

Change 'theservice instance' to 'the service instance' in opts
 "Use x509 certificates in order to authenticate to the service
 instance."

Change 'userpassword' to 'user's password' in opts
 "ZFSSA management authorized user's password."

Change-Id: I3b8f4d7e06aac1a72632e665f20fabccc23379a4
Closes-bug: #1650872
Closes-Bug: #1650875

commit_message:
Added support for managing glance images in Trove role

For hosting the database, Trove launches the nova instances
using glance image. The current Trove role does not support
this functionality.

This patch has added support for creating glance images
(for mysql, mongodb, percona db) in Trove container.

Change-Id: Iffa55dcd3c21ca5c125addef023a59ab14db2d8b
Closes-Bug: #1626730

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ib0e088b93c0588c8d083d32e398c3a4b1b7186cf
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Exclude Ansible 2.5 from driver-reqs

Ansible 2.5 appears to be incompaible with the current
ansible driver interface. Until we've sorted it out,
we should block >=2.5.0 from being installed.

Related-Bug: #1758462

Change-Id: I9c3b2528f8da28554e3eb4e03528517a6c6c326f

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I9bd440a026578846d570cf750728c01e6f4b7e36
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Upgrade data on disk on mariadb major upgrade

Add an ansible task to run mysql_upgrade whenever a container
image upgrade causes a major upgrade of mariadb (e.g. 5.5 -> 10.1)

. If the overcloud was containerized prior to the major upgrade, the
  mysql upgrade job is ran in an ephemeral container (where the latest
  version of mysql comes from) and uses credentials from the Kolla
  configuration.

. Otherwise the upgrade job is run from the host (once the mysql
  rpm has been updated) and uses credentials from the host.

We log the output of the script in the journal. Also, the mysql server
needs to be started temporarily, so use a temporary log file for it
when run from the ephemeral container.

Change-Id: Id330d634ee214923407ea893fdf7a189dc477e5c

commit_message:
Conventional log directories for pacemaker bundles

Use /var/log/containers/<service> instead of /var/log/<service>, as
the rest of the containerized services.

Change-Id: Id5760c16260de991ff95168c76186edc113752c8
Depends-On: Icb311984104eac16cd391d75613517f62ccf6696
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1731969

commit_message:
Make unstable functional test non-voting

Given that the functional build for this repo
rarely passes and the repo itself is only
maintained by those who use it, we can set the
functional test to non-voting in order to allow
general pattern changes to be implemented
without delay.

This does mean that reviewers applying functional
changes will have to be disciplined about checking
the results, but I think that is OK in this case.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556253
Change-Id: I1a236b88a8c80d82f162a92f6cdfeb9368b6eea7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-25 19:12:46.000000000', 'message': "Make HA containers log to /var/log/containers after upgrade

HA containerized services currently log under
/var/log/pacemaker/bundles/{service-replica}.

Move the logging of those HA services into /var/log/containers,
like all the paunch-managed containers. Also leave a readme.txt
in the previous location to notify the change (taken from
Ic8048b25a33006a3fb5ba9bf8f20afd2de2501ee)

Only the main service log is being moved, e.g. for mysql:
  . mysqld.log now ends up in /var/log/containers/mysqld.log
  . pacemaker logs stay under /var/log/pacemaker/bundles/{service-replica}

Note: some HA services don't need to be changed during upgrade:
  . cinder-{backup|volume} log under /var/log/containers/cinder
  . manila-share log under /var/log/containers/manila
  . haproxy only logs to the journal

Change-Id: Icb311984104eac16cd391d75613517f62ccf6696
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1731969
(cherry picked from commit f4a45b751b4ed66a68d65de9032fede11ed6236c)
"}]
commit_message:
Make HA containers log to /var/log/containers after upgrade

HA containerized services currently log under
/var/log/pacemaker/bundles/{service-replica}.

Move the logging of those HA services into /var/log/containers,
like all the paunch-managed containers. Also leave a readme.txt
in the previous location to notify the change (taken from
Ic8048b25a33006a3fb5ba9bf8f20afd2de2501ee)

Only the main service log is being moved, e.g. for mysql:
  . mysqld.log now ends up in /var/log/containers/mysqld.log
  . pacemaker logs stay under /var/log/pacemaker/bundles/{service-replica}

Note: some HA services don't need to be changed during upgrade:
  . cinder-{backup|volume} log under /var/log/containers/cinder
  . manila-share log under /var/log/containers/manila
  . haproxy only logs to the journal

Change-Id: Icb311984104eac16cd391d75613517f62ccf6696
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1731969
(cherry picked from commit f4a45b751b4ed66a68d65de9032fede11ed6236c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-23 13:52:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix nit found in monasca-ui

In some part in the code we use \ for multiline formatting. In the Openstack
style guidelines they recommend to use ().
[1]: "It is preferred to wrap long lines in parentheses and not a backslash
for line continuation.".
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/latest/user/hacking.html

Change-Id: I0c34cd9343e07aaec3bf543e9a1828db55d07246
(cherry picked from commit 5c71236b14e795867f67de938d7a6301f71fc17a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nit found in monasca-ui

In some part in the code we use \ for multiline formatting. In the Openstack
style guidelines they recommend to use ().
[1]: "It is preferred to wrap long lines in parentheses and not a backslash
for line continuation.".
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/latest/user/hacking.html

Change-Id: I0c34cd9343e07aaec3bf543e9a1828db55d07246
(cherry picked from commit 5c71236b14e795867f67de938d7a6301f71fc17a)

commit_message:
Fix the nova config file location

The location of the nova config file changed after the service was
containerized. This patch fixes the location to make the Nova
NoOpFirewallDriver validation work again.

Partial-Bug: #1744322
Change-Id: I9151f68d6674b8c39168d388c902fe05f802fa83

commit_message:
Fix libvirt plugin to handle FQDN of compute node

The change adds simple logic to check the actual name of the compute
node. The list of nova services is filtered with FQDN hostname and if
not successful with unqualified name.

Change-Id: I9ba044f26b53a52afbac0fcd99552a4135cd4725
Story: 2001679
Task: 6785
(cherry picked from commit f3e7ff1450e1f90fdbfebff7159b41954477ef1e)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I3550d3e1b2c1e038d52e6ccfae132669fed077d0
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add pre_upgrade_rolling_tasks

The resultin pre_upgrade_rolling_steps_playbook will be executed in a
node-by-node rolling fashion at the beginning of major upgrade
workflow (before upgrade_steps_playbook).

The current intended use case is special handling of L3 agent upgrade
when moving Neutron services into containers. Special care needs to be
taken in this case to preserve L3 connectivity of instances (with
regard to dnsmasq and keepalived sub-processes of L3 agent).

The playbook can be run before the main upgrade like this:

openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles overcloud --playbook pre_upgrade_rolling_steps_playbook.yaml

Partial-Bug: #1738768
Change-Id: Icb830f8500bb80fd15036e88fcd314bf2c54445d
Implements: blueprint major-upgrade-workflow

commit_message:
Consume ceph-container project's new style of tags

The ceph-container project is moving to a new style of tags for
Ceph. Update scenario001/004 to pull Ceph container images using
the new tags.

commit_message:
Reload AppArmor when policies are changed

AppArmor needs to be reloaded when new policies are written, not only
when the 'aa-profile-mode' config option is changed.

Change-Id: Ia2990cdc03f6fa0d3a38e4a3247422f0950ee0eb
Closes-Bug: 1755823

commit_message:
Fix libvirt plugin to handle FQDN of compute node

The change adds simple logic to check the actual name of the compute
node. The list of nova services is filtered with FQDN hostname and if
not successful with unqualified name.

Change-Id: I9ba044f26b53a52afbac0fcd99552a4135cd4725
Story: 2001679
Task: 6785
(cherry picked from commit f3e7ff1450e1f90fdbfebff7159b41954477ef1e)

commit_message:
Add python_venv_build ansible role to OSA deliverables

In OpenStack-Ansible python venvs are built, packaged
and consumed at run-time. Currently this uses the same
code across multiple roles. This role will be used by
OpenStack-Ansible to replace the duplicated code in
every OSA role but could also be used by any other
project who may wish to.

The role is registered as an independent deliverable as
it is not expected to require frequent releasing.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/553392
Change-Id: Ic4bad4c0cebe018c4a27e0cc79faf9186b7707de

commit_message:
Update G-R for oslo.concurrency>=3.26.0

The cinder project requires new parameter 'sanitize_stdout' in
method oslo_concurrency.processutils.ssh_execute that is merged
with [0] and only available in oslo.concurrency 3.26.0 or newer.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547388/

Change-Id: I4e119c4e494b6302ca698dda467a07d91d0e0630
Closes-bug: #1482382

commit_message:
resolves string formatting issue in alarm_history

string substitution fails with alarm id if self.url is
assigmed as variable. This patch replaces this var to
resolves the issue as mentioned in the bug 1758667
Closes-Bug: 1758667

Change-Id: I2e5507053940c81d3b516823078139265a1c9b30

commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

We install packages twice, the -U for pip install will update requirements
to newer versions and might download even an older versions. Remove it.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/554297
Change-Id: I967f10d9adb9e63fdbfd727c564f503db1aad7ca

commit_message:
Fix libvirt plugin to handle FQDN of compute node

The change adds simple logic to check the actual name of the compute
node. The list of nova services is filtered with FQDN hostname and if
not successful with unqualified name.

Change-Id: I9ba044f26b53a52afbac0fcd99552a4135cd4725
Story: 2001679
Task: 6785

commit_message:
Have glance notifications work like the other projects

Currently glance has a very simplistic ability to configure
notifications which seems different than nova and neutron which
both allow for selecting the topics used. In order to make glance
work like the others just have glance be configured like the other
projects notifications are being configured.

Change-Id: Ia12993e1b86d040c2705e72b32f93b874fe4adc6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-25 10:34:29.000000000', 'message': 'add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I5c23fc5f4e31b461255865fb8973cc05c448e364
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I5c23fc5f4e31b461255865fb8973cc05c448e364
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Use the pbr generated wsgi binary file located in binary folder

Since pbr 1.4.0, wsgi_scripts entrypoing is supported and it will
generated a wsgi compatible binary file. No need to copied it to
/var/www/cgi-bin/keystone folder.

Change-Id: If85558dcdcdf185be6171de20eed3faa8e101661

messages:
[{'account_id': 24099, 'date': '2017-12-04 01:55:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12767, 'date': '2018-02-15 10:28:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12767, 'date': '2018-02-15 10:30:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Rebased and merged.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-02-16 08:10:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-03-14 16:28:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Thank you for the contribution, this looks very good and it pleases me to see rich docstrings and unit tests!

I do need to ask you to create a small functional test that exercises the action.

With that in place we can quickly assess that this works across all supported combinations of operating system and Ceph versions and at the same time make sure your code keeps running in the future.

Take a look at function test_402_pause_resume_actions in tests/basic_deployment.py for inspiration.'}, {'account_id': 24099, 'date': '2018-03-22 07:44:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24099, 'date': '2018-03-22 07:45:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

 > 
 > With that in place we can quickly assess that this works across all
 > supported combinations of operating system and Ceph versions and at
 > the same time make sure your code keeps running in the future.
 > 
 > Take a look at function test_402_pause_resume_actions in
 > tests/basic_deployment.py for inspiration.

Thanks for the review Frode, I have added a simple functional test. Let's see what Canonical CI thinks of it."}, {'account_id': 24099, 'date': '2018-03-22 23:26:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add get-health action to the Ceph mon charm

* get-health - outputs `ceph health` output

Including unit and functional tests for the above actions.

Change-Id: Id4c0a89f2068a6f30025d4a165f84ad112b62cf7
Closes-Bug: #1720099

commit_message:
Set max_microversion 2.38 for nova image-metadata tests

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id35

Besides, there's inconsistency between https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#create-image-metadata
and https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id35,
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554813/ will fix it.

Change-Id: Ic6cc22f048c2ccd427dfe6e6aea0273128d96592

[{'created': '2018-03-23 08:30:46.000000000', 'message': "Add usage with travis CI to docs

This change adds a description how to use reno within a travis CI
setup. It's neither a bug in Travis nor in reno. It's just a
different set of expectations of these two. As reno gets used
outside of OpenStack too, it makes sense to clarify the usage.

Change-Id: I675402402d5eb3d9afd374c149b21c75977946c7
Related-bug: 1703603
"}]
commit_message:
Add usage with travis CI to docs

This change adds a description how to use reno within a travis CI
setup. It's neither a bug in Travis nor in reno. It's just a
different set of expectations of these two. As reno gets used
outside of OpenStack too, it makes sense to clarify the usage.

Change-Id: I675402402d5eb3d9afd374c149b21c75977946c7
Related-bug: 1703603

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-18 05:24:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tests for snapshots extended_snapshot_attributes policy

This fixes the Patrole test for
"volume_extension:extended_snapshot_attributes" which is
incorrectly being executed by a creat test which is wrong according
to [0]. Instead, the test should be executed for GET /snapshots
and GET /snapshots/details. Further, the test should use soft
or non-fatal authorization, which was recently fixed in Cinder [1].
Finally, the tests should live in test_volumes_snapshots_rbac
for the same reason the policy is listed under snapshots family
of policies in cinder [0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/831665f59a0d87f2dbf7fa4f7496305977a98b0f/cinder/policies/snapshots.py#L48
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553657/1

commit_message:
Fix tests for snapshots extended_snapshot_attributes policy

This fixes the Patrole test for
"volume_extension:extended_snapshot_attributes" which is
incorrectly being executed by a create test which is wrong according
to [0]. Instead, the test should be executed for
GET /snapshots/{snapshot_id} and GET /snapshots/details. Further, the
test should use soft or non-fatal authorization, which was recently
fixed in Cinder [1].

Finally, the tests should live in test_volumes_snapshots_rbac
for the same reason the policy is listed under snapshots family
of policies in cinder [0].

The expected attributes for these tests can be found here: [2].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/831665f59a0d87f2dbf7fa4f7496305977a98b0f/cinder/policies/snapshots.py#L48
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553657/1
[2] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/831665f59a0d87f2dbf7fa4f7496305977a98b0f/cinder/api/contrib/extended_snapshot_attributes.py#L25

Change-Id: I7770148584e10a08b3e133b1793a1533f1728fc1

The version bump of microversion-parse package from 0.1.2 to 0.2.1
contains a change to the get_version call. The service_type which was
a keyword argument has now become positional (see commit #4b04aaf3).
This patch changes the invocation to make sure we adapt the version

commit_message:
Fix invocation to get_version from microversion-parse

The version bump of microversion-parse package from 0.1.2 to 0.2.1
contains a change to the get_version call. The service_type which was
a keyword argument has now become positional (see commit #4b04aaf3).
This patch changes the invocation to make sure we adapt the version
checking behavior accordingly.

Change-Id: Ibb20204ebe9ac5998be4989050180d76475fdfb6

subject: Make unstable functional test non-voting
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-25 18:32:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27143, 'date': '2018-03-25 18:40:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nThank you, Jesse.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-03-25 18:55:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-03-26 01:57:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-26 04:11:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-25 18:32:22.000000000', 'message': 'Make unstable functional test non-voting

Given that the functional build for this repo
rarely passes and the repo itself is only
maintained by those who use it, we can set the
functional test to non-voting in order to allow
general pattern changes to be implemented
without delay.

This does mean that reviewers applying functional
changes will have to be disciplined about checking
the results, but I think that is OK in this case.

Change-Id: I061fcad972cef542b8c3988b5a5a178d65ce5b72
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556253
'}]
commit_message:
Make unstable functional test non-voting

Given that the functional build for this repo
rarely passes and the repo itself is only
maintained by those who use it, we can set the
functional test to non-voting in order to allow
general pattern changes to be implemented
without delay.

This does mean that reviewers applying functional
changes will have to be disciplined about checking
the results, but I think that is OK in this case.

Change-Id: I061fcad972cef542b8c3988b5a5a178d65ce5b72
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556253
